title: 232. CHRISTMAS CIDER
info:
CHRISTMAS CIDER

ingredients

2 qt. apple cider
1 c. brown sugar
3 3 inch cinnamon sticks
1 tsp. whole cloves
1 tsp. salt

preparation

Heat to boiling point. Add remaining ingredients and simmer about 15 minutes. Strain and serve warm.

title: 218. NANA'S CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
NANA'S CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1/2 lb. candied cherries, halved
2 c. pecans, ground/finely chopped
3 whole slices candied pineapple, chopped
1/2 c. flour
1/4 tsp. salt
3 egg whites, stiffly beaten
1/2 c. sugar

preparation

Place fruits in bowl. Sift flour over fruit mixture. In a separate glass bowl, beat egg whites until stiff. Add sugar to egg whites and beat together. Add fruit/flour mixture to egg white mixture. Add nuts. Fold well. Drop by teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350° for approximately 15 to 20 minutes or until light brown in color. Check for doneness by flipping over.

title: 291. MOM'S CHRISTMAS PIE
info:
MOM'S CHRISTMAS PIE

ingredients

2 Tbsp. butter
3/4 c. sugar
2 c. milk
2 egg whites, well beaten
1/4 c. cornstarch
1/2 tsp. salt
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Scald milk. Melt butter and blend in cornstarch, sugar and salt. Gradually add milk to melted butter mixture. Cook mixture until fairly thickened. Remove from fire; add gradually to beaten egg whites. Stir in vanilla. Pour into baked 9-inch pie shell and bake in 350° oven for 5 minutes. When cool, top with whipped cream. Garnish with chopped nuts.

title: 122. CHRISTMAS TOFFEE
info:
CHRISTMAS TOFFEE

ingredients

1 C butter
1 C sugar
1 Tbsp white corn syrup
3 Tbsp water
1 pkg almonds or walnuts
1 6 oz pkg semi-sweet chocolate morsels (melted)

preparation

Butter a cookie sheet. Melt butter in 2 qt. sauce pan, stir in sugar gradually. Add syrup and water. Cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally until a little bit in cold water becomes very brittle.

Add 1 C nuts. Pour onto pan. When cool, pour melted chocolate over the toffee. Break into bite size pieces.

title: 253. CRANBERRY BANANA CHRISTMAS BREAD
info:
CRANBERRY BANANA CHRISTMAS BREAD

ingredients

1 1/2 c. self-rising flour
1 tsp. baking powder
1/2 tsp. baking soda
1 c. cranberries, chopped
1 1/2 ripe banana
1/2 c. sugar
1/3 c. oil
1 large egg
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Mix all ingredients together. Spray a loaf pan with nonstick spray. Bake at 350° for 35 to 40 minutes. Serves 16.

title: 119. BUCHE DE NOEL (CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE ROLL)
info:
BUCHE DE NOEL (CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE ROLL)
(Holiday)

ingredients

6 egg whites (at room temperature)
1/2 c. sugar
6 egg yolks
1/2 c. sugar
1 1/2 c. finely chopped (grated) walnuts
4 Tbsp. sifted cocoa
1 tsp. baking powder
powdered sugar for topping

preparation

Preheat oven to 350°. Butter a 10 x 15-inch jelly roll pan. Line it with waxed paper, extending 4-inches beyond the ends of the pan. Butter the waxed paper and set it aside. Wet a towel and squeeze it until it is damp-dry.

In a large mixing bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Continue beating and adding 1/2 cup sugar slowly, until whites are stiff and glossy.

Beat yolks with 1/2 cup sugar until mixture is very thick. Beat in the walnuts, cocoa and baking powder until blended. Fold in beaten egg whites.

Pour batter into prepared pan and spread evenly. Bake at 350° for about 25 minutes, or until top is golden and a cake tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Immediately cover cake with slightly dampened towel. Allow cake to cool and then refrigerate. Leave towel on cake. This can be done 2 days ahead.

The day before serving, turn cake out on 2 overlapping strips of waxed paper. Remove the baking paper and trim edges of cake. Spread Chocolate Whipped Cream mixture over the cake. Using the waxed paper to help you, roll cake up from long end, ending seam side down. Sprinkle top with sifted powdered sugar to resemble snow. Serve 10-12.

Chocolate Whipped Cream:

ingredients

1 1/2 c. cream
1/3 c. sugar
3 Tbsp. sifted cocoa
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Beat all ingredients together until stiff.

title: 163. CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY
info:
CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY

ingredients

3 1/2 c. sugar
1 c. light corn syrup
1 c. water
1/4 to 1/2 tsp. cinnamon or peppermint oil
1 tsp. red or green food coloring

preparation

In a heavy saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook on medium heat until candy thermometer reads 300° (hard-crack stage), stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat. Stir in oil and food coloring, keeping face away from mixture as aroma is very strong. Immediately pour onto an oiled cookie sheet. Cool. Break into pieces. Store in airtight containers.

title: 267. CHRISTMAS COOKIES-SINGLE BATCH
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES-SINGLE BATCH

ingredients

1 c. shortening
1 c. powder sugar
2 c. flour
1 egg
2 Tbsp. milk
1 tsp. baking soda
1 tsp. cream of tartar
1 tsp. vanilla
2 c. sugar
2 tsp. cinnamon
2 c. shredded carrots
1-7 oz. pkg. coconut
1 c. chopped nuts
2 c. unsifted flour
2 tsp. baking soda
1 tsp. salt
3/4 c. oil
3 eggs, unbeaten
2 tsp. vanilla
1 small can crushed pineapple, drain

preparation

Bake for 45 minutes at 350 degrees in a 9 x 13 pan. Test for doneness with a toothpick.

title: 281. CHRISTMAS CRUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS CRUNCH

ingredients

1 large bag M&M's (in Christmas colors)
1 jar dry roasted peanuts (with salt)
1/2 box Golden Grahams cereal
pretzel sticks (optional)
1 lb. vanilla almond bark

preparation

Mix together all of the ingredients and spread mixture out on waxed paper. Melt almond bark in microwave and pour over mixture. Let cool and crumble up. Store in covered container.

title: 141. CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL
info:
CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL

ingredients

equal amounts of cream cheese and Cheddar cheese
dash of Worcestershire sauce
1/2 tsp. garlic powder
dash of cracked pepper
1/4 c. chives
1/2 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Mix equal amounts of cream cheese and Cheddar cheese. Roll into log or ball. Place line of chili powder on wax paper and roll. Sprinkle top with chives, paprika and pepper.

title: 174. CHRISTMAS WREATHS
info:
CHRISTMAS WREATHS

ingredients

1/2 cup oleo
40 large marshmallows
4 1/2 cups corn flakes
1/4 tsp. green food coloring
red hots

preparation

Melt oleo and marshmallows. Add food coloring and pour over corn flakes. Stir until flakes are coated. Using a 1/4 cup measure, coated with cooking spray, portion out warm cereal mixture onto cookie sheet. With buttered fingers, mold into wreaths. Dot with red hot candies.

title: 210. CHRISTMAS MORNING PANCAKES
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING PANCAKES

ingredients

2 c. self-rising flour
2 c. buttermilk
2 eggs
Option: Add food coloring (red or green) if desired

preparation

Preheat griddle to 400 degrees. Spray with pam. Mix all three ingredients until smooth. Pour batter on griddle and flip when pancake starts to look dry on top. Top each one with a pat of butter. Serve with syrup or honey. Can top with powdered sugar.

title: 242. Christmas Toffee
info:
Christmas Toffee

ingredients

2 cups Sliced Almonds (about 8 oz.)
12 oz. Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips (2 cups)
2 sticks Butter, cut into bits
1 1/2 cups Packed Dark Brown Sugar

preparation

1. Preheat oven to 325°. Spread out almonds on a baking sheet and bake, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, 5-7 minutes. Let cool.

2. Coarsely chop chocolate chips in a food processor, pulsing on and off. Transfer to a medium bowl. In same processor bowl, coarsely chop almonds, pulsing on and off. Add to chocolate chips, tossing to combine Spread half of mixture evenly over bottom of a well-greased baking sheet.

3. In a heavy saucepan, bring butter and brown sugar to a boil, stirring constantly, over medium heat. Cook 5-7 minutes or until syrup is golden brown and just reaches the hard crack stage (300° on a candy thermometer). At that point, a bit of syrup, when dropped into a bowl of ice water, should separate into threads that are hard and brittle.

4. Pour hot syrup evenly over nut mixture. Top with remaining nut mixture, smoothing and pressing down gently with a spatula. Refrigerate until toffee is set and chocolate is firm, about 1 1/2 hours. Cut into irregular pieces with tip of a sharp knife. Store in tightly covered container in refrigerator up to 2 weeks.

title: 34. CHRISTMAS TORTILLA ROLL-UP
info:
CHRISTMAS TORTILLA ROLL-UP

ingredients

1 pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch
2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
1/3 c. chopped celery
1/4 c. green onion, minced fine
1/2 c. red pepper, chopped
1/4 c. green olives, chopped
flour tortillas

preparation

Mix ingredients together well. Refrigerate. Spread on tortilla; then roll tortilla up. Slice into 1-inch pieces.

title: 101. CHRISTMAS SIX LAYER COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS SIX LAYER COOKIES

ingredients

1 stick butter
1 pkg. chocolate pieces
1 pkg. butterscotch pieces
1 can condensed milk
2 to 3 c. graham cracker crumbs
1 to 2 c. nuts, chopped
1 to 2 c. coconut

preparation

You will also need a glass pan with greased sides.

Melt butter and mix with graham cracker crumbs to make bottom crust. Layer chocolate, nuts, butterscotch and coconut. Pour milk over all and bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350°.

title: 100. CHRISTMAS TOFFEE BARS
info:
CHRISTMAS TOFFEE BARS

ingredients

2 sticks butter
1 egg yolk
1 c. chopped pecans or walnuts
1 c. brown sugar
2 c. flour
5 Hershey chocolate bars

preparation

Mix and pour in pan. Bake 25 minutes at 350°. Cool and cut in small squares.

title: 46. CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST

ingredients

1-1/2 lbs sausage
9 slices white bread
1 stick butter, softened
2 c cheddar cheese, shredded
8 eggs
2-1/2 c half & half
1-1/2 tsp salt
1-1/2 tsp dry mustard

preparation

Butter the bread and cut into cubes. Put in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Brown the sausage. Drain and crumble over the bread. Put cheese over the sausage and bread. Mix together eggs, half & half, salt and dry mustard. Pour over the cheese. Cover and refrigerate overnight (8 hours). Heat oven to 350°. Bake for 40-50 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve with biscuits and fresh fruit.

title: 91. CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD

ingredients

2 c. cranberries (fresh or frozen)
3 c. miniature marshmallows
3/4 c. granulated sugar
2 c. diced apples (unpeeled)
1/2 c. chopped pecans
1 c. heavy cream, whipped
1/2 c. seedless grapes

preparation

Blend cranberries well in blender. In a mixing bowl, combine cranberries, marshmallows and sugar. Refrigerate overnight. Add apples, grapes and pecans to cranberry mixture. Mix well. Fold in whipped cream. Serve immediately. This salad looks pretty served in a glass bowl.

title: 194. JOAN'S CHRISTMAS BAKE
info:
JOAN'S CHRISTMAS BAKE

ingredients

2 to 3 slices bread, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1 lb. bulk sausage (Jimmy Dean type), cooked
6 eggs
2 c. milk
1/2 tsp. mustard
dash of Tabasco (optional)
1 c. or more shredded Cheddar cheese
1/2 tsp. each salt and pepper

preparation

Place bread cubes in shallow baking dish. Top with cooked sausage (lumps broken up) and grated cheese. For a special treat, make this with Cracker Barrel New York Cheddar. This is a flexible recipe. I have used as many as 10 to 12 eggs, more milk, etc., and up to 1 pound of sausage. I think it tastes better with more cheese.

title: 193. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

1 pkg. lime Jell-O
3/4 c. boiling water
1/4 c. pineapple juice
1 c. cream
1 medium size can crushed pineapple, drained
2 mashed bananas
24 miniature marshmallows (I use more than 24)
4 oz. cream cheese
1 c. nuts

preparation

Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water. Add pineapple juice and allow to cool, then add cream. Chill in refrigerator until it reaches the mushy stage. Add other ingredients and mix well. Put in bowl and refrigerate.

title: 197. CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE

ingredients

1 doz. eggs
4 c. milk
1 lb. sausage
6 pieces of bacon
10 pieces crumbled bread
16 oz. shredded cheddar cheese

preparation

Cook sausage and bacon. Mix eggs, milk, crumbled bread and cheese in a large bowl. Add crumbled sausage and bacon. Place in 9x13 greased dish. Place in refrigerator overnight. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour.

title: 66. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 lb. white raisins
1 lb. assorted dried fruit
1 lb. pecans
1 lb cherries
1/2 c. shortening
1 1/2 c. brown sugar
1/2 c. fresh orange juice
3 c. plain flour
1 tsp nutmeg
1 tsp. clover
1 tsp. cinnamon
3 Tbsp. Sour Milk
1 tsp. soda
1/2 tsp salt
4 eggs

preparation

Melt shortening and cream with sugar. Add 1 egg at a time, mixing well. Have spices, soda and salt sifted together saving 1 c. flour to pour over fruit, raisins, pecans and cherries. Add O.J. and milk then add fruit, raisins, nuts and cherries. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Bake 15 - 20 minutes. Makes 5 dozen cookies dropped by heaping spoon full onto cookie sheet.

title: 182. GRANNY'S CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
GRANNY'S CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 large can pineapple juice
1 Tbsp. almond flavoring
1 1/2 c. sugar
1 carton lime sherbet
18 oz. bottle real lemon juice
1 pkg. lime jello
1 jar maraschino cherries

preparation

Place all ingredients in gallon jug and fill up with water. When ready to serve, pour into punch bowl and add lime sherbet and maraschino cherries.

title: 111. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. margarine
1 c. light brown sugar
3 c. plain flour
1/2 c. milk
3 eggs
1 tsp. soda
1 tsp. cinnamon
1 tsp. salt
3 tsp. vanilla
1 box white raisins
6 slices crystallized pineapple
1/2 lb. crystallized cherries
1 lb. chopped dates
7 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Cream margarine and sugar. Add eggs, one at a time. Add flour, milk, cinnamon, salt, soda and vanilla. Pour over fruit and nuts. Mix well. Drop by spoon onto cookie sheet. Bake 25 minutes at 300°.

title: 54. CHRISTMAS STRAWBERRIES
info:
CHRISTMAS STRAWBERRIES

ingredients

1 c. finely chopped almonds
1 c. Eagle Brand milk
1 family size pkg. strawberry jello
1 c. coconut
1 tsp. vanilla
red and green sugar

preparation

Mix almonds, Eagle Brand, jello, coconut and vanilla. Form into strawberry shape. Roll in red sugar. Roll top in green sugar.

title: 186. CHRISTMAS RAMEKIN
info:
CHRISTMAS RAMEKIN

ingredients

4-5 cloves of garlic, chopped
3/4 c. red pepper, chopped very small
2 jars of marinated artichoke hearts
olive oil
1-2 Tbsp. diced hot jalapeno peppers
1/4 lemon (squeezed)
1/2-1 c. mayonnaise
3/4 lb. parmesan cheese, grated

preparation

Cut bread down the middle and slice into strips. Drizzle with butter (and garlic if you desire) and bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes.

Meanwhile, saut garlic in oil. In bowl mix artichokes, red pepper, hot jalapeno pepper, cheese, and garlic. Add enough mayonnaise so it all holds together. Add the lemon juice. Bake at 350 uncovered for 30-35 minutes until it bubbles and the top is golden.

Serve with the French bread immediately.

title: 107. CHRISTMAS ROCK COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS ROCK COOKIES

ingredients

2 sticks margarine (1 cup)
1 1/2 c. sugar
1 tsp. cinnamon
1 tsp. cloves
3 eggs
1 tsp. soda
2 Tbsp. hot water
1 lb. chopped nuts
3 boxes dates, pitted
1 c. green cherries, dried
1 c. red cherries, dried
pinch of salt
3 c. flour plain, all-purpose

preparation

Mix butter, sugar; cream then add eggs and water. Mix cinnamon, cloves and flour; all but 1/2 cup sprinkle over fruit to keep it from all sticking together. Stir fruit into dough mixture. Bake at 375° 10 to 15 minutes or until lightly brown around edges. Cool on wire rack. Store tightly in plastic container for up to 3 weeks.

title: 117. WHITE CHRISTMAS FUDGE
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS FUDGE

ingredients

2 c. sugar
2/3 c. milk
1/4 c. butter or margarine
12 oz. white chocolate, coarsely chopped
1/2 tsp. almond extract (optional)
3/4 c. dried cherries or cranberries, coarsely chopped
3/4 c. toasted almond slices

preparation

Line 8-inch square pan with foil, then grease foil. Mix sugar and milk in 3-quart saucepan. Over medium heat, add butter and bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil for another 5 minutes without stirring. On low heat, add chocolate and almond extract. Stir, then whisk until chocolate melts and mixture is smooth. Stir in dried cherries (or cranberries or apricots) and toasted almonds. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Refrigerate 2 hours until firm. Invert pan; peel off foil and cut into 1-inch squares. Garnish as desired.

title: 208. CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY BREAD
info:
CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY BREAD

ingredients

2 c. all purpose flour
3/4 c. sugar
1 Tbsp. baking powder
2 beaten eggs
1 c. milk
1/3 c. butter melted
1 tsp. vanilla
1 c. cranberries, chopped
1/2 c. chopped walnuts

preparation

Combine flour, sugar and baking powder in a large bowl. Combine eggs, milk, melted butter and vanilla in a medium bowl. Make a well in the dry ingredients. Add egg mixture, stirring just till moistened. Fold in cranberries and walnuts. Spread in a greased 9 x 5 x 3 in loaf pan. Bake in 350 oven 55 minutes or till toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan or wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove loaf from pan. Cook thoroughly on wire rack. Wrap and store overnight for easier slicing. Makes 1 loaf.

title: 37. SPICY CHRISTMAS PICKLES
info:
SPICY CHRISTMAS PICKLES

ingredients

1 gal. jar dill pickles
5 lb. bag sugar
1 bottle Louisiana hot sauce
3 garlic cloves, chopped

preparation

Drain juice from pickles and discard. Slice pickles into spears and put in jar. Add hot sauce, garlic and 1/3 of sugar. Screw on lid tightly. Gently mix pickles with sugar and spices by tipping jar back and forth. Leave on counter at room temperature for 1 week. As sugar dissolves, add more sugar until all sugar is used. Mix pickles daily. Pickles will be dark green when all sugar is absorbed.

title: 177. CHRISTMAS AROMA
info:
CHRISTMAS AROMA

ingredients

1 qt pineapple juice
1 qt water
1 qt apple cider
4 pieces ginger
3 (3 inch) sticks cinnamon
16 whole cloves
1 tsp allspice
1 or 2 tsp pickling spice

preparation

Place all ingredients in a large cooking kettle and allow to come to a boil for several minutes, then turn down heat and allow ingredients to simmer. The room will fill with a wonderful Christmas time odor. Add water and stir as needed.

*DO NOT DRINK. FOR AROMA ONLY.

title: 72. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

3 pkg. cherry Kool-Aid
2 qt. water
2 c. sugar
1 small frozen lemonade
1 small frozen orange juice
1 large can pineapple juice
1 large bottle ginger ale

preparation

Mix all ingredients together in 2 quart container. Add ginger ale. Real good.

title: 266. CHRISTMAS ROCKS
info:
CHRISTMAS ROCKS

ingredients

1 c. butter, softened
1 3/4 c. light brown sugar
3 eggs
1 tsp. vanilla
1 1/2 tsp. baking soda
2 tsp. cinnamon
1 tsp. ground cloves
3 c. flour
1 lb. light raisins
1 lb. pecan pieces
1 c. diced red candied cherries

preparation

Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs, vanilla and dry ingredients, mixing well. Add fruit and nuts; mix well. Spoon onto cookie sheet covered with parchment paper. Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.

title: 93. CHRISTMAS PIE
info:
CHRISTMAS PIE

ingredients

5 eggs
2 1/2 c. hash browns
1/2 c. cottage cheese
1 1/2 c. shredded swiss cheese
1/3 c. milk
1 tsp. salt
8 slices crumbled bacon
1/8 tsp. pepper
1 Tbsp. bacon fat
2 chopped green onions
1/2 c. corn flake crumbs

preparation

Beat eggs until foamy. Stir in hash browns, cheese, milk, onions and seasoning. Pour into 9 inch pie tin. Cook bacon until crisp. Save 1 Tbsp. of fat. Crumble bacon over egg mixture. Combine cornflakes and bacon fat. Sprinkle over egg mixture. Cover and refrigerate over night. Bake uncovered at 325 degrees for 50 minutes or until golden brown.

title: 262. CHRISTMAS CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS CAKE

ingredients

1/2 lb. butter
1 cup sugar
5 eggs
1 tsp. vanilla extract
1 tsp. lemon extract
2 cups plain flour
1 (18 oz or 16 oz.) pineapple preserves
1 lb. glazed cherries
4 cups nuts (chopped)

preparation

Cream butter, add sugar gradually, beating well after each addition. Add eggs one at a time. Add flavorings. Add flour and mix. Add pineapple preserves, cherries and nuts last. Bake 250° until done. At least 2 hours.

title: 88. CHRISTMAS FRUIT SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS FRUIT SALAD

ingredients

3 egg yolks, beaten
3 Tbsp. water
3 Tbsp. vinegar
1/2 tsp. salt
2 c. whipping cream, whipped
3 c. miniature marshmallows
2 c. halves green grapes
1 (20 oz.) can pineapple tidbits, drained
1 (11 oz.) can mandarin oranges, drained
1 (10 oz.) jar red maraschino cherries, drained and sliced
1 c. chopped pecans
3 Tbsp. lemon juice

preparation

In a large saucepan, combine egg yolks, water, vinegar and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and reaches 160°. Remove from heat and cool. Fold in whipped cream.

In a large bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Add dressing. Toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Yield: 12 to 14 servings.

title: 131. CHRISTMAS CANDY
info:
CHRISTMAS CANDY
(Makes 24 Servings. Prep Time: 10 Minutes.)

ingredients

24 oz. almond bark
2 c. Rice Krispies
1 c. peanuts or cashews
1 1/2 c. miniature marshmallows

preparation

Melt almond bark. Add Rice Krispies, nuts and marshmallows. Mix and drop onto waxed paper.

title: 158. CHRISTMAS WREATHS
info:
CHRISTMAS WREATHS

ingredients

38 large marshmallows
1 stick (1/2 cup) margarine
1/2 tsp. vanilla
green food coloring (enough to make it the shade of green desired)
1 1/2 cups corn flakes (DO NOT CRUSH!!)
Red hots and silver decorations for the berries

preparation

Melt the marshmallows and margarine in the top of a double boiler or over very low heat until melted. Stir in vanilla and food coloring to tint to the desired shade of green. Combine marshmallow mixture and corn flakes. Stir to mix all flakes with the marshmallow mixture. Stir carefully so not to break the flakes. Drop by heaping tablespoons on buttered foil. Then shape into wreaths, using your fingers dipped into cold water so it is easier to shape. Decorate with red hots or decorations to make Christmas wreaths.

title: 160. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

4 eggs
3 Tbsp. milk
1 c. butter
1 box brown sugar
1 Tbsp. cinnamon
1 Tbsp. nutmeg
1 Tbsp. cloves
2 Tbsp. soda
3 c. flour
1 pkg. white raisins
1/2 lb. candied pineapple
1 c. liquor
6 c. pecans

preparation

Beat eggs and milk. Cream butter, sugar and spices. Add flour; mix well. Add soda to liquor and mix. Add fruit and nuts. Dough is easier to work with if refrigerated overnight.

title: 268. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 1/2 c. brown sugar
1/4 c. shortening
4 eggs
3 Tbsp. buttermilk
1 tsp. baking soda
2 c. all purpose flour
1 lb. candied pineapple
1 lb. candied cherries
1 lb. candied dates
1 c. flour, to dredge fruit in
6 c. pecans
1/4 c. grape juice

preparation

Cream sugar and shortening; add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Add buttermilk, soda and 2 cups of flour. Cut candied fruits into small pieces and dredge pieces in 1 cup flour. Mix in fruits and nuts; add grape juice. Drop on cookie sheet with spoon. Bake at 300 for 20 minutes. Makes 4-5 dozen.

title: 143. CHRISTMAS RELISH
info:
CHRISTMAS RELISH

ingredients

10 carrots
10 green tomatoes
10 onions
5 red peppers
5 green peppers
4 c. sugar
3 c. vinegar
1 Tbsp. celery seed
1 Tbsp. mustard seed
1/2 c. salt

preparation

Put salt over ground up vegetables. Let stand 1 hour. Mix well, rinse and squeeze out liquid. Heat vinegar, sugar and spices and pour over vegetables. Pour into jars. No need to seal. (I seal mine.)

title: 85. CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD

ingredients

1 each of 4 oz. pkg. lemon and raspberry jello
2 c. water
1 can plain cranberry sauce mashed (not the whole berry kind)
10 oz. frozen raspberries thawed enough to separate them
7 oz. sprite

preparation

Add jellos to water and bring to boil; dissolve stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in berries; add cranberry sauce and put in your serving bowl. Gently add Sprite; chill overnight and add topping.

Topping:

ingredients

1 c. pineapple juice
1/2 cup sugar
1 beaten egg
2 Tbsp. cornstarch
1 tsp. margarine
2 c. Cool Whip

preparation

Combine all except Cool Whip and cook in double boiler until thick. Chill 1 hour; fold in Cool Whip and spread on gelatin.

title: 211. CHRISTMAS BREAD
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAD

ingredients

1 pkg. dry yeast
1/2 c. warm water
2 1/2 c. biscuit mix
1 Tbsp. sugar
1 egg, beaten
1 pkg. cream cheese (8 oz.)
1/2 c. sugar
1 Tbsp. lemon juice
1/4 c. cherry preserves

preparation

Proof yeast in warm water for 5 minutes. Add biscuit mix, 1 tablespoon sugar and egg. Stir well. Knead dough on floured surface until smooth. Place in buttered bowl. Turn to grease top and chill 8 hours. Punch dough down and turn into greased 14 x 9-inch baking sheet. Roll dough out to fit sheet. Combine cream cheese, sugar and lemon juice. Beat together until smooth. Spread mixture 2 inches wide down the length of the dough. Make 3-inch cuts in dough at 1-inch intervals along the edges. Fold and overlap strips diagonally to make a braid. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk. Bake 20 minutes at 350°. Remove from oven and spoon preserves down the center. Return to oven for 5 minutes to melt. Cool 10 minutes before serving.

title: 222. M&M CHRISTMAS TREES
info:
M&M CHRISTMAS TREES

ingredients

1 can vanilla frosting
1 bottle green food coloring
1 pkg. pointed sugar ice cream cones
1 pkg. 4 inch sugar cookies
1 pkg. mini M&Ms
1 pkg. Holiday M&Ms
1 pkg. wrapped candy for the trim

preparation

Set aside 1/3 c. of frosting. Add food coloring to the remaining frosting. Stir until well blended. Cover cookie with white frosting. Stick the cone to the cookie. Cover entire cone with green frosting. While frosting is moist, stick the Holiday M&Ms to the cone. Use mini M&Ms to decorate as colored lights. Use wrapped candy to decorate around the bottom of the tree.

title: 159. CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE

ingredients

6 cups raisins or 2 cups white raisins or currants
2 cups prunes
8 1/2 cups mixed candied fruit
3 cups walnuts
1 Tbsp orange rind
1/2 cups fruit juice
5 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoon salt
3 teaspoons baking powder
1 lb. shortening crisco
2 cups white sugar
1 cup brown sugar
3 teaspoons cinnamon
2 teaspoons cloves
1 teaspoon allspices
2 teaspoons mace
1 teaspoon vanilla
10 well beaten eggs

preparation

Rinse raisins and drain on towel. Pour boiling water over prunes. Let stand 10 minutes. DRAIN DRY, use scissors and cut up. Combine nuts, rind, all fruits. Pour juice over and let stand.

*Mix separate. Sift flour, salt and baking powder together. Cream shortening, sugars and eggs and spices. Mix well and add flour mixture and vanilla. Stir well and add to fruit. Mix well until all fruit is evenly distributed. Pour into loaf pans that are well lined with well greased brown paper. Bake at 275° from 3 3/4 to 4 hours. Makes 10 pounds. Wrap in juice (wring out) soaked gauze (cheesecloth). Place in foil and cool place to ripen.

title: 95. CHRISTMAS MORNING SAUSAGE RING
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING SAUSAGE RING

ingredients

2 lb. sausage
1 1/2 c. cracker crumbs
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1/2 c. milk
1/4 c. minced onion
1 c. finely chopped apple

preparation

Combine ingredients; Mix well. Pack lightly into greased 6-cup ring mold; Chill several hours. Unmold into jelly roll pan. Bake in 325° gas oven for 1 hr. Serve with scramble eggs in center. Makes 12 servings

title: 51. CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAD
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAD

ingredients

1 pkg. frozen bread rolls
1 small pkg butterscotch flavored cook and serve pudding
1 1/2 stick butter
1 c. brown sugar
1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
1 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Grease bundt pan. Place frozen bread rolls, 18 small squares into pan evenly. Shake 1 small dry pudding mix over bread. Melt butter and mix with brown sugar. Put mixture over bread. Shake cinnamon and pecans over rolls. Place towel over bundt pan and set it out overnight. In the morning, preheat oven, bake for 30 minutes in a 350° oven. Cool for 10 minutes; turn out onto serving dish and serve.

title: 188. CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL
info:
CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL

ingredients

2 (8 oz.) packages cream cheese
3 green onions, chopped
1 (2 1/2 oz.) jar dried beef, chopped
1 (4 oz.) can mushrooms, chopped
1 (2 1/4 oz.) can chopped ripe olives
2 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Mix all but pecans. Shape into ball (cone for a tree) with Saran wrap and refrigerate. To serve, roll ball in pecans or slice stuffed green olives for tree decorations. Top with a cinnamon star cookie.

title: 251. CHRISTMAS RIBBON SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS RIBBON SALAD

ingredients

2 (16 oz.) cans pitted, dark, sweet cherries, chopped
2 (3 oz.) pkg. cherry flavored Jell-O
1 pkg. unflavored gelatin
2 c. boiling water
1/3 c. sugar
1/2 c. Port wine or other sweet flavored red wine (sweet vermouth works)
1/4 c. lemon juice
1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2 c. pecans, chopped

preparation

Drain cherries, reserving 1 cup juice. Chop cherries. Stir together gelatins and 2 cups boiling water until dissolved. Stir in reserved cherry juice, sugar, wine and lemon juice. Stir in cherries. Pour half of the mixture into a lightly greased 10-cup ring mold or Bundt pan. Chill 2 hours or until almost set.

Stir together remaining Jell-O mixture, softened cream cheese and pecans. Blend well. This is the tricky part. Make sure the cream cheese is really soft and blend the Jell-O into the cream cheese a little at a time. Pour over slightly set Jell-O mixture in mold. Cover and chill 6 hours or overnight. Unmold before serving and garnish with whipped cream and/or cranberries if desired.

title: 41. WHITE CHRISTMAS CHILI
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS CHILI

ingredients

4 skinless boneless chicken breasts
5 c. water
1 large onion, chopped and divided
2 Tbsp. butter
2 celery ribs, chopped
3 (16-oz.) cans great Northern beans, rinsed, drained, divided
3 cans (4.5-oz. each) chopped green chiles
1 c. chicken broth
1 tsp. ground cumin
1 bay leaf
1 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. ground red pepper
1 Tbsp. chopped fresh cilantro

preparation

Place chicken, 5 cups water, and half of onion in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat, and cook 1 hour or until chicken is very tender. Remove chicken, reserving cooking broth in Dutch oven. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces; set aside.

Melt butter in a skillet; add celery and remaining onion, and sauté until tender. Stir chicken, celery mixture, 2 cans of beans, and next 6 ingredients into broth in Dutch oven, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at least 1 hour, stirring frequently, until thickened. Process remaining 1 can beans in a blender until smooth, stopping to scrape down sides. Stir bean puree into chili. Heat soup to simmering. Remove and discard bay leaf; stir in cilantro just before serving.

title: 190. CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS CRANBERRY SALAD

ingredients

1 lb. fresh cranberries
2 pkg. cherry flavored gelatin
1 c. sugar
1 c. chopped celery
1 can no. 2 crushed pineapple
1/2 c. chopped nuts
1 c. chopped grapes

preparation

Cook the cranberries in 3/4 cup water a few minutes, until tender. While still hot, dissolve the gelatin and sugar in this mixture. Let cool to lukewarm. Add the grapes, celery, undrained crushed pineapple and nuts. Chill in a 1 1/2 qt. ring mold. Serve with Snowy Dressing.

Snowy Dressing:

ingredients

1 c. whipped cream
120 miniature marshmallows
3 oz. cream cheese

preparation

Whip the cream and whip in the softened cream cheese. Fold in the marshmallows.

title: 135. CHRISTMAS CIDER
info:
CHRISTMAS CIDER
(Makes 1 Gallon)

ingredients

1 Aspen mulling spices
1 gal. apple cider
1 large cran-grape frozen concentrate
1 large lemonade frozen concentrate
2/3 amount water (that concentrate calls for 2)

preparation

Heat all together.

For Cold Drink: Omit water. Add club soda.

Good fall beverage.

title: 283. CHRISTMAS CHILI ROLL
info:
CHRISTMAS CHILI ROLL

ingredients

1 pound longhorn cheese (ground)
2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce
8 ounce package cream cheese
1/3 cup chopped pecans
Chili powder, Salt, pepper, garlic powder to taste

preparation

Thoroughly mix cheese with ground cheese. Add all other ingredients and mix well. Shape into 4 rolls. Put chili powder on wax paper. Wrap rolls in aluminum foil and refrigerate until used. Slice before serving or cheese can be made into balls and at room temperature can be used as spread. Sharp cheddar cheese can be substituted instead of longhorn.

title: 277. WHITE CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

2 c. sugar
1 c. water
1 (12 oz.) can evaporated milk
1 Tbsp. almond extract
3 (1/2 gal.) cartons vanilla ice cream, softened
6 (2 liter) bottles Sprite, chilled

preparation

Combine sugar and water in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Add evaporated milk and almond extract. Let cool. Chill until ready to serve.

Combine milk mixture and remaining ingredients in punch bowl, just before serving, stirring to break ice cream into small pieces. Yield: About 3 1/2 gallons.

Can add ice chips to make it colder.

title: 59. ROLLED CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
ROLLED CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 C. butter
1 1/2 C. powdered sugar
1 egg
1 tsp. vanilla
2 1/2 C. flour
1 tsp. baking soda
1 tsp. cream of tartar
1/4 tsp. salt

preparation

Mix ingredients in order. Cream together first four ingredients. Mix together the dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture.

Chill; roll; cut out shapes.

Bake at 375 degrees for 5 minutes.

title: 115. CHRISTMAS M&M'S COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS M&M'S COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. margarine, softened
1 c. light brown sugar
1/2 c. sugar
2 eggs
2 tsp. vanilla
2 1/4 c. flour
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. baking soda
2 c. M&M's miniature semi-sweet (red and green)

preparation

Preheat oven to 375°. Beat together butter, brown sugar and white sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Blend in eggs and vanilla. Combine flour, salt and baking soda in a small bowl. Add to butter mixture. Mix well. Add M&M's. Drop by teaspoons and bake for 10 to 12 minutes.

title: 200. CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAKFAST CASSEROLE

ingredients

6 slices white bread or low-carb wheat
butter or margarine
1 lb. pork sausage
2 c. Cheddar cheese, grated
6 eggs, beaten
2 c. half and half
1 tsp. salt

preparation

Remove crusts from bread and spread with butter. Place them side by side in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Brown sausage and crumble; drain. Layer over bread slices. Sprinkle with cheese. Combine eggs, half and half and salt and mix well. Cover and chill Christmas Eve night. Bake, uncovered, Christmas morning at 350° for 40 to 55 minutes.

Note: This is an easy breakfast for a busy morning.

Yield: 8 servings.

title: 29. WHITE CHRISTMAS CHIFFON PIE
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS CHIFFON PIE

ingredients

1 1/2 c. milk
4 Tbsp. flour
1 c. sugar
1/4 c. cold water
1/2 c. heavy cream
3 large egg whites
1 1/2 c. freshly shredded coconut
1 envelope unflavored gelatin
3/4 tsp. vanilla
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. almond extract
1/4 tsp. cream of tartar
2 baked pie shells

preparation

Soften gelatin in cold water. Mix together in a saucepan the milk, flour and sugar; cook to slightly thicken and dissolve the gelatin in that. Cool. Then whip the cream. Beat the egg whites until stiff and add the cream of tartar. To the gelatin mixture, fold in the whipped cream and the egg whites. Add the vanilla and almond extract. Then fold in the coconut. Spoon into the pie shells and chill in the refrigerator.

title: 165. CHRISTMAS CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS CAKE

ingredients

1 box angel food cake, baked, cooled and cut in half
1 pkg. cream cheese, softened
1 box confectioners sugar
1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip
1 can Lucky cherry pie filling

preparation

Cream sugar and cream cheese. Add Cool Whip. Spread on cake half. Put on top and the rest of the cake. Put cherries on top of and some in the middle of the cake. The cake cuts best with electric knife.

title: 245. CHRISTMAS NIBBLINGS
info:
CHRISTMAS NIBBLINGS

ingredients

1 large box pretzels, broken
1 large box Rice Chex
1 large box Corn Chex
1 can peanuts
pecans
1/2 c. bacon or ham grease
1 1/2 sticks oleo
1 Tbsp. garlic salt
1 Tbsp. savory salt
1 to 2 tsp. chili powder
1 tsp. red pepper
1 Tbsp. Tabasco sauce
1/4 c. Worcestershire sauce

preparation

Melt grease and oleo and add seasonings. Pour over other ingredients and mix well. Mix often while baking in slow oven for 1 1/2 hours at 200°.

title: 244. CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL
info:
CHRISTMAS CHEESE BALL

ingredients

2 (8 oz) cream cheese
1 (8 oz) sharp yellow cheese
1 T pimento, chopped
1 hunk Velveeta
1 T green pepper, chopped
1 T grated onion
1 tsp lemon juice
2 tsp Worcestershire sauce
Dash of red pepper
Dash of salt
Pecans (to roll in)

preparation

Mix altogether and put in freezer about 20 minutes. (Chunk all cheese to mix.) Shape into ball and roll in pecans. (Put pecans in blender). Refrigerate until served.

Serve with Ritz or your choice crackers.

title: 207. CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS

ingredients

1 bag 24 frozen dinner rolls
1 box (3 3/4 oz.) butterscotch pudding, not instant
1/2 c. butter
3/4 tsp. cinnamon
3/4 c. brown sugar
1/2 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Arrange rolls in greased fluted pan. Sprinkle dry pudding mix over rolls. Cook remaining ingredients over low heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture bubbles. Pour over rolls. Cover tightly with foil. Let stand overnight on counter top. Next morning, bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

title: 99. CHRISTMAS (OR ANYTIME) COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS (OR ANYTIME) COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. butter
1 c. sugar
2 Tbsp. milk
1 tsp. flavoring of your choice
2 1/2 c. self-rising flour
3/4 c. flaked coconut
1/2 c. finely chopped pecans
3/4 c. finely chopped red and green candied cherries

preparation

In a mixing bowl, combine softened butter with sugar and cream. Add milk and flavoring. Stir in flour, candied cherries and pecans. Form in 2 rolls. Roll in coconut; wrap in wax paper and chill overnight.

Slice 1/4-inch thickness; place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake in 375° oven for 12 minutes, until edges begin to brown.

title: 65. CRANBERRY CHRISTMAS CAKE
info:
CRANBERRY CHRISTMAS CAKE

Cranberry Filling:

ingredients

1 (8 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained
1/4 c. pineapple syrup
2 Tbsp. plus 1 tsp. cornstarch
1 (16 oz.) can whole cranberry sauce

preparation

Blend syrup and cornstarch in saucepan. Stir in pineapple and cranberry sauce. Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened and boiling. Boil and stir for 1 minute. Fill layers and top of cake.

title: 297. NUTTY PEANUT BUTTER  CHRISTMAS FUDGE
info:
NUTTY PEANUT BUTTER CHRISTMAS FUDGE

ingredients

3/4 c. evaporated milk
1/4 c. butter
2 1/4 c. sugar
1 3/4 c. (7 oz. jar) Marshmallow Creme
2 c. (12 oz. pkg.) peanut butter chips
1 tsp. vanilla
1 c. broken walnuts

preparation

Combine evaporated milk, butter, sugar and Marshmallow Creme in a heavy 2 3/4-quart saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture begins to boil. Continue cooking and stirring 5 minutes; remove from heat. Immediately add peanut butter chips and vanilla, stirring until chips are melted. Add nuts. Pour into a buttered 8 or 9-inch square pan. Cool. Makes about 3 pounds.

title: 199. CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAKFAST PIE
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING BREAKFAST PIE

ingredients

1 lb. sausage
9 inch pie shell
1 1/2 c. grated swiss cheese
1/2 c. bell pepper
1/2 c. red pepper
2 tsp. onion chopped
4 eggs beaten
1 c. light cream

preparation

Cook sausage, drain, add cheese, mix well. Sprinkle mixture in pie shell. Beat eggs, add onions, peppers, and cream. Pour in pie shell bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Serve. Garnish with red and bell peppers. Can be refrigerated overnight and baked the next morning. This is great for a quick breakfast on Christmas morning.

title: 22. CHRISTMAS BONBONS
info:
CHRISTMAS BONBONS

ingredients

1 can sweetened condensed milk
2 lb. powdered sugar
1 c. oleo or butter
1 pkg. (7 oz.) flaked coconut
2 c. chopped nuts
1 c. glace cherries
4 pkg. (8 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate

preparation

Combine milk, powdered sugar and oleo. Mix until smooth and creamy. Add coconut, walnuts and cherries; mix thoroughly. Chill 1 hour. Form into small balls. Chill another 2 hours. Melt chocolate. Dip individually into chocolate. Place on waxed paper to cool. Chill in refrigerator. Makes about 150 pieces.

Can use any dipping chocolate.

title: 98. TRADITIONAL CHRISTMAS BREAD
info:
TRADITIONAL CHRISTMAS BREAD
(Romanian)

ingredients

Sweet bread dough
10 oz. ground walnuts
1 cup milk
3/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup rum
Vanilla

preparation

Melt sugar in warm milk with vanilla in a saucepan. When the sugar is melted, add the walnuts and keep stirring. After a few minutes of boiling, and after filling has thickened, remove from heat and add rum. When the filling is cold, roll a sheet of dough about 1/2 inch thick. Uniformly spread the filling on top and roll like a jelly roll. Grease a bread pan and place the roll inside. Let rise. Bake in oven until done. (Temperature and baking time was not provided.)

title: 20. 7-POUND CHRISTMAS FUDGE
info:
7-POUND CHRISTMAS FUDGE

ingredients

3 large (8 oz.) bars milk chocolate, broken in small pieces
2 (11.5 oz.) pkg. milk chocolate bits
1 large (13 oz.) jar Marshmallow Creme
4 c. sugar
1 tall (13 oz.) can evaporated milk
1/2 lb. butter
2 tsp. vanilla
1 c. chopped black walnuts, walnuts or pecans

preparation

In large mixing bowl of heavy-duty electric mixer, combine broken chocolate bars, chocolate bits and Marshmallow Creme; set aside. In large heavy saucepan, combine sugar, evaporated milk and butter. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture boils; boil 5 minutes. Pour hot mixture over chocolate mixture. Beat until ingredients are thoroughly blended; beat in vanilla. Remove beater and stir in chopped nuts. Quickly pour mixture into buttered 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan. Cool. Cover tightly and refrigerate until firm enough to cut into small squares. (Flavor will be best after a week or two of storage.) Makes about 7 pounds fudge.

title: 168. CHRISTMAS TEA
info:
CHRISTMAS TEA

ingredients

1 qt. or 1/2 gallon apple cider
2 qts. ginger ale
4 sticks cinnamon
1 pkg. red hots

preparation

Mix ingredients in large saucepan or coffee maker. Heat apple cider and ginger ale adding cinnamon sticks and red hots until they dissolve. Stir before serving. May heat again if necessary.

title: 42. CHRISTMAS RIBBON SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS RIBBON SALAD

ingredients

2 cans (16 oz. each) pitted dark sweet cherries
2 (3-oz) pkg. cherry-flavored gelatin
1 envelope unflavored gelatin
2 c. boiling water
1/3 c. sugar
1/2 c. port or sweet red wine
1/4 c. lemon juice
1 (8-oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
1/2 c. pecans, chopped and toasted
Garnishes: whipped cream, fresh cranberries (optional)

preparation

Drain cherries, reserving 1 cup juice. Chop cherries. Stir together gelatins and 2 cups boiling water until completely dissolved. Stir in reserved cherry juice, sugar, port, and lemon juice. Stir in cherries. Lightly spray a 10-cup ring mold or Bundt cake pan with vegetable cooking spray, and pour half of gelatin mixture into mold. Chill 2 hours or until almost set. Stir together remaining gelatin mixture, cream cheese, and pecans, blending well. Pour over slightly set gelatin mixture in mold. Chill 6 hours or until firm. Garnish, if desired.

title: 152. CHRISTMAS MORNING CHEESE CLOUD
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING CHEESE CLOUD
(Serves 8 to 10)

ingredients

12 slices bread, crust off
1 lb. Cheddar cheese, grated
1 lb. sausage, cooked, drained and squeezed greaseless
4 eggs
1/4 tsp. salt
2 1/2 c. milk
1 Tbsp. grated onion
1 tsp. seasoned salt
1/2 tsp. prepared mustard
dash of cayenne pepper
dash of black pepper

preparation

Place 6 slices of buttered bread in buttered dish. Place 1/2 cheese and meat over bread. Add 6 slices of buttered bread, then rest of meat and cheese. Beat eggs. Add milk, onion and seasoning to eggs. Pour this over layered bread and meat. Place in refrigerator overnight. Bake at 350° in preheated oven 1 hour. Let stand 10 to 15 minutes.

title: 94. CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE

ingredients

1 bag partially thawed hash browns
4 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1 c. Parmesan cheese
10 eggs
4 c. milk
2 bottles Hormel "real" bacon bits
dash of pepper
1 tsp. dry mustard

preparation

Prepare 24 hours ahead of time.

Put thawed frozen hash browns in bottom of greased pan. Beat eggs until well blended. Add other ingredients and mix by hand well. Pour over hash browns. Cover and put in refrigerator.

Next morning, bake at 350° for an hour or until eggs are set.

title: 219. CHRISTMAS MUD SQUARES
info:
CHRISTMAS MUD SQUARES

ingredients

3/4 c. graham cracker crumbs
3/4 c. chopped pecans
1/4 c. brown sugar
1/4 c. butter, melted
1 (12 oz.) jar caramel
3 Tbsp. all-purpose flour
1 c. butter
4 (1 oz.) sq. chocolate (unsweetened)
1 1/2 c. sugar
1 c. all-purpose flour
4 eggs, beaten
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Combine first 4 ingredients, stirring well. Press crumb mixture into bottom of a greased 9-inch square pan. Bake at 350° for 6 to 8 minutes; cool slightly. Combine caramel and 3 tablespoons flour, stirring well. Spread topping on crust to within 1/4-inch from edge. Set aside.

Combine 1 cup butter and chocolate in saucepan. Cook over low heat until melted. Stir in sugar and next 3 ingredients. Pour mixture over caramel in pan. Bake at 350° for 50 minutes. Cool and spread with chocolate frosting. Yields 16 squares.

Christmas Mud Frosting:

ingredients

1 Tbsp. butter
2 Tbsp. cocoa
2 Tbsp. water
1 c. sifted xxx sugar
1/4 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Combine first 3 ingredients in a small saucepan. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in sugar and vanilla. To decorate, lightly sprinkle xxx over frosting. Add pecans and candied cherries.

title: 92. CHRISTMAS PIE RICE
info:
CHRISTMAS PIE RICE

ingredients

1 green or red pepper
1 c. long grain wild rice, uncooked
1 1/4 c. water
2 small cans chicken and rice soup
1 stick margarine
1 small onion
1 tsp. salt

preparation

Mix and bake 1 hour at 400°.

title: 74. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 gal. apple cider
6 lemons
6 small oranges
1 qt canned pineapple juice
1 3-inch stick cinnamon
8 whole cloves
3 pieces ginger
1/2 tsp. salt

preparation

Place the spices in a bag of fine cheesecloth. Peel & cut into thin slices the lemons and oranges, mixing with the apple cider and pineapple juice. To this add the bag of spices and bring to a very low simmering boil. Stir as it simmers for approximately 15 minutes, then add salt and stir vigorously. Just prior to serving, add as much rum as preferred.

title: 139. CHIP BEEF CHRISTMAS DIP
info:
CHIP BEEF CHRISTMAS DIP
(Or Anytime)

ingredients

1 (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
1 bunch green onions (stems and all)
garlic powder to taste
jar chopped beef or 1 pkg. Buddig (or other brand) beef, ham or pastrami, cut into small pieces

preparation

Rinse onions and pat them dry with paper towel. Chop into small pieces. Combine other ingredients and mix well. May be served right away or refrigerated several hours.

Good with vegetables or crackers.

title: 180. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 (64 oz.) carton Minute Maid fruit punch
1 (6 oz.) can Minute Maid frozen concentrate for limeade, thawed (undiluted)
1 (23 oz.) bottle sparkling mineral water

preparation

In punch bowl, combine fruit punch and limeade concentrate. Chill. Just before serving, add the sparkling water. Keep cold with ice ring or chunk of ice. Makes 28 servings (about 1/2 cup each).

title: 201. CHRISTMAS MORNING STRATA
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING STRATA

ingredients

1 1/2 lb. Italian sausage, casing removed -chop meat
1- 12 oz. loaf French bread (or Italian bread)
2 - 4 oz. cans sliced mushrooms
6 extra large eggs
1 quart milk
2 tsp. Italian seasoning
1/2 tsp. garlic powder
1/4 tsp. pepper
2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese

preparation

Night before serving, grease 13 x 9 glass baking dish. Cook sausage meat, using slotted spoon remove sausage to paper towel to drain. Cut bread into 1/2 inch cubes. Drain and chop mushrooms. In baking dish combine meat, bread and mushrooms. In large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk and seasonings. Pour egg mixture over sausage mixture. Cover baking dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.

About 1 1/2 hours before serving preheat oven to 350°. Bake uncovered 1 hour. Remove from oven and sprinkle evenly with cheese. Bake 15 minutes longer or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let stand 10 minutes before serving. Serves 8.

title: 134. OLD FASHIONED CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE
info:
OLD FASHIONED CHRISTMAS CHOCOLATE

ingredients

4 c. sugar
2 c. butter
2 c. milk
1 c. cocoa
2 Tbsp. vanilla
3 c. crushed peanuts
3-4 c. flour

preparation

Mix & cook sugar, butter, milk, and cocoa for 20 min., stirring occasionally. Add vanilla, peanuts (crushed), and flour.

Mix well & pour into a greased cookie sheet. When almost cold, cut into your size squares.

title: 196. CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST CASSEROLE

ingredients

1 pkg. hash browns (or shredded baked potato)
1 stick margarine
salt and pepper
4 eggs (I use Eggbeaters for cholesterol free)
1 can chopped green chiles
1/2 chopped green pepper
1/2 chopped onion
1/2 chopped Polish sausage (I use turkey-fat free)
1/2 c. chopped ham
3/4 c. shredded cheese (cheddar or Monterey Jack)

preparation

Mix hash browns, margarine, salt and pepper and press into 8 x 12 pan. Bake at 400 until golden brown. I do this the day before and store in refrigerator. Combine remaining ingredients and pour into cooked hash brown crust. Bake until eggs are set, about 20 minutes, in 375 degree oven.

title: 275. CHRISTMAS CRUNCHERS
info:
CHRISTMAS CRUNCHERS

ingredients

2 c. pretzel pieces, broken
1 can (3 oz) chow mein noodles
1 1/2 c. salted roasted peanuts
5 c. miniature marshmallows
6 tbsp. butter or margined
red and green candy melts, melted

preparation

Line baking sheets with waxed paper, coat with cooking spray. In large mixing bowl, combine pretzels, noodles and peanuts; set aside. In pot over medium heat, melt marshmallows with butter; cook, stirring until smooth. Pour over reserved pretzel mixture; stir until well coated. Coat hands with cooking spray, shape mixture into 1 1/2 in. mounds, place on baking sheets. Using fork drizzle stacks with melted candy melts.

title: 161. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 lb. butter
2 1/2 c. sugar
2 eggs
5 c. flour
1 Tbsp. soda
4 slices of candied pineapple
3 oz. candied cherries
1 c. white raisins
2 c. nuts
dash of salt

preparation

Cream butter, sugar and eggs. In another bowl, sift flour, soda and salt together. Cut the pineapple, cherries and raisins in small pieces. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture saving a cup of flour to coat the fruit so it won't stick together. Put all together after fruit is coated, then add the nuts. Roll into rolls on wax paper and refrigerate until firm. Can be frozen for several months until ready to make. Slice 1/4 inch each, bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes. I use parchment cooking paper. After first baking, others may take less time. Don't get them too brown.

title: 166. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

2 large cans pineapple juice
1 1/2 c. sugar
2 frozen cans pink lemonade (small)
1/2 gal. strawberry ice cream
4 bottles ginger ale

preparation

Mix and stir to dissolve sugar and pineapple juice. Add 1/2 gallon of ice cream and lemonade. Stir in ice cream until dissolved. Add 4 bottles of ale.

title: 286. WHITE CHRISTMAS CHILI
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS CHILI

ingredients

4 skinned and boned chicken breast halves
5 c. water
1 large onion, chopped and divided
2 Tbsp. butter or margarine
2 celery ribs, chopped
3 (16 oz.) cans Great Northern beans, rinsed, drained and divided
3 (4.5 oz.) cans chopped green chilies
1 c. canned chicken broth
1 tsp. ground cumin
1 bay leaf
1 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. ground red pepper
1 Tbsp. chopped fresh cilantro
toppings (tortilla chips, shredded Colby-Jack cheese, salsa, sour cream)

preparation

Place chicken, 5 cups water and half of onion in a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat and cook 15 to 18 minutes or until chicken is tender. Remove chicken, reserving broth in Dutch oven. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces; set aside.

Melt butter in a skillet; add celery and remaining onion and saut until tender. Stir chicken, celery mixture, 2 cans beans and next 6 ingredients into broth in Dutch oven and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook 1 hour, stirring frequently, until thickened. Process remaining 1 can beans in a blender until smooth, stopping to scrape down sides. Stir bean puree into chili. Remove and discard bay leaf; stir in cilantro just before serving with desired toppings. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: 82. CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS
info:
CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS

ingredients

2 pkg 8 oz cream cheese, softened
pkg 4 oz ranch salad dressing mix
1/2 c minced sweet peppers
1/4 c sliced stuffed olives
1/4 c sliced green pepper
3-4 flour tortillas

preparation

In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and dressing; mix until smooth. Add red peppers, celery, onion, olives, mix well. Spread about 3/4 c on each tortilla. Roll up tightly wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate 2 hours; slice 1/2 inch pieces.

title: 147. CHRISTMAS FRUIT SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS FRUIT SALAD

ingredients

3 egg yolks, beaten
3 Tbsp. water
3 Tbsp. vinegar
1/2 tsp. salt
2 cups whipping cream, whipped
3 cups miniature marshmallows
2 cups halved green grapes
1 can (20 oz.) pineapple tidbits, drained
1 can (11 oz.) mandarin oranges, drained
1 jar (10 oz.) red maraschino cherries, drained and sliced
1 cup chopped pecans
3 Tbsp. lemon juice

preparation

In a large saucepan, combine egg yolks, water, vinegar and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and reaches 160 degrees. Remove from the heat; fold in whipped cream. In a large bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Add dressing, toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours.

Yield: 12-14 servings.

title: 231. WASSAIL CHRISTMAS DRINK
info:
WASSAIL CHRISTMAS DRINK

ingredients

1 gal. apple cider or juice
1 c. brown sugar
1 to 2 Tbsp. allspice
2 sticks cinnamon

preparation

Mix all together and simmer for 30 minutes. Makes a delicious Christmas drink.

title: 36. CHRISTMAS MIX
info:
CHRISTMAS MIX

ingredients

3 c. Corn Chex cereal
3 c. Rice Chex cereal
3 c. Cheerios (plain)
1 (12 oz.) bag red and green M&M's
1 (12 oz.) jar or 2 1/2 c. salted peanuts
3 c. thin pretzel sticks, broken in half
1 to 1 1/2 lb. white chocolate

preparation

Mix all ingredients except chocolate. Melt white chocolate and pour over mixed ingredients. Mix all together, then spread on wax paper or cookie sheet. Once completely cooled, break into little clusters.

title: 32. CHRISTMAS FUN FOR THE KIDS
info:
CHRISTMAS FUN FOR THE KIDS

ingredients

2 c. flour
1/2 tsp. baking soda
1/2 tsp. salt
2 c. warm water
cookie cutters
small paint brush

preparation

Preheat oven to 350°. Blend all ingredients until well mixed. You may have to add more flour if too wet or more water if too dry. Flour working area and roll dough out until 1/4 inch thick. Dip cookie cutter in the flour and cut out ornaments. Place on lightly greased cookie sheet. Use the end of the paint brush to punch a hole in the top to hang by. Decorate with paints, glitter and ribbon.

title: 224. WHITE CHRISTMAS CANDY
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS CANDY

ingredients

2 lbs. white candy coating, cut into small chunks
1/2 lb. crushed candy canes or crushed peppermint candies

preparation

Melt candy coating over medium low heat, stirring until smooth. Stir in peppermint candy. Spread on waxed paper lined baking sheets; refrigerate for 8 to 10 minutes. Break into small pieces; store in an airtight container.

title: 105. CHRISTMAS DATE SQUARES
info:
CHRISTMAS DATE SQUARES

ingredients

1 pkg. dates
1/2 c. sugar
1 c. water
2/3 c. butter
1 c. brown sugar
1 1/2 c. rolled oats
1/2 tsp. vanilla
1/2 tsp. salt

preparation

Combine dates, sugar and water; cook all together until thick and put aside. Combine remaining ingredients thoroughly to make oat mixture. Put 1/2 of oat mixture into a pan and pat down. Layer the date mixture on top. Pour remainder of oat mixture on top. Bake in moderate oven until light brown.

title: 181. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

2 pkg. Kool-Aid (sugar sweetened)
1 can frozen orange juice, thawed
1 lg. can pineapple juice

preparation

Mix all ingredients in a gallon jug. Fill remainder of jug with water.

title: 142. CHRISTMAS PICKLES
info:
CHRISTMAS PICKLES

Step 1:

ingredients

2 gal. cucumbers
2 c. lime
2 gal. water
1 c. vinegar
1 tsp. alum
1 bottle red food coloring

preparation

*See step 2 for the rest of the ingredients.

DAY 1 - Step 1: Slice, peel, and cut cucumbers into rings, taking out seeds. Mix ingredients - covering rings and simmer 2 hours. DO NOT BOIL. Drain.

Go to step 2.

Step 2:

ingredients

3 c vinegar
15 c sugar
1 lb red hots candy
3 c water
10 cinnamon sticks

preparation

Boil mixture, pour over cucumbers and let stand over night.

Day 2: Drain cucumbers and bring syrup to a boil. Pour over rings and set stand over night.

Day 3: Repeat (day 2 process).

Day 4: Put all into sterilized jars and seal.

title: 221. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

3 Tbsp. sugar
1 1/2 c. cornflake crumbs
1/2 c. butter or margarine, melted
1 (6 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips
1 1/2 c. (3.5 oz. can) coconut flakes
1 c. coarsely chopped walnuts or pecans
1 can Eagle Brand condensed milk

preparation

Mix first 3 ingredients and press to bottom of 9 x 13 ungreased cake pan. Scatter chocolate morsels over this mixture. Spread coconut over top of chocolate morsels. Sprinkle nuts on coconut. Drizzle condensed milk over top of nuts. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes until lightly brown at edges.

title: 206. CHRISTMAS STOLLEN
info:
CHRISTMAS STOLLEN

ingredients

2 c. milk
1 lb. shortening (2 c.)
1 c. sugar
2 tsp. salt
4 eggs, beaten
2 yeast cakes or dry powdered yeast
8 c. flour
1 c. citron
1 c. raisins
2 Tbsp. grated lemon rind
2 Tbsp. grated orange rind
1 tsp. nutmeg
1/4 c. water
butter

preparation

Scald milk. Pour over shortening, sugar and salt. Cool to lukewarm. Add eggs; add yeast that has been softened in 1/4 cup water.. Add 4 cups flour and beat. Add citron, raisins, rind, nutmeg and remaining flour. Knead and place in covered pan to rise 3 to 4 hours.

Punch down and divide into loaves. Cover and let rise 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Bake at 325° for 50 minutes. While bread is still hot, spread butter over top of each loaf.

title: 282. RETHA'S CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY
info:
RETHA'S CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY

ingredients

3 1/2 c. sugar
1 c. hot water
1 c. white corn syrup

preparation

Add drops of food coloring while cooking.

Combine all ingredients and cook to 300°. Stir in small bottle of flavored oil to coordinate with the color of candy.

Pour out onto a cookie sheet dusted with powdered sugar.

Cut into strips and then pieces when cool enough to handle.

title: 238. AROMA OF CHRISTMAS
info:
AROMA OF CHRISTMAS

ingredients

3 sticks cinnamon
1/4 c. whole cloves
peel one orange
2 bay leaves
2 lemon wedges
1 quart water

preparation

Combine spices and fruit with water in sauce pan or crockpot. Bring to a boil and simmer. Check hourly; add water as needed.

title: 280. HEAVENLY CHRISTMAS MARMALADE
info:
HEAVENLY CHRISTMAS MARMALADE

ingredients

11 oz. pkg. dried apricots
20 oz. can of crushed pineapple
4 oz. jar maraschino cherries
1 c. orange juice
5 c. sugar

preparation

Soak apricots overnight in enough water to cover. The next day cook until soft enough to crush with a spoon. Add crushed pineapple, drained and cut up cherries, orange juice and sugar.

Cook 25 - 30 minutes.

Be careful that it does not scorch.

Pour into sterilized jars and seal.

(Makes a nice gift.)

title: 252. CHRISTMAS PIE
info:
CHRISTMAS PIE

ingredients

1 can pie cherries
1 can crushed pineapple
1 c. sugar
2 Tbsp. cornstarch
1 box orange jello
1 c. sliced bananas
1 c. chopped nuts
2 baked pie shells

preparation

Mix cherries, pineapple, sugar, cornstarch together and cook until thick. Stir in dry jello and let cool. Add bananas and nuts. Pour into pie shells and refrigerate until ready to serve.

title: 60. CHRISTMAS CUT OUT COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS CUT OUT COOKIES

ingredients

1/2 C. butter
3/4 C. sugar
1 egg
1 1/2 tsp. vanilla
1 1/2 C. flour
1 tsp. baking powder
1/4 tsp. salt

preparation

Cream butter, sugar, egg and vanilla. Mix in remaining ingredients.

Chill at least one hour. Roll out thin for cutting out.

Bake at 350 degrees until lightly brown.

May choose to double this recipe.

title: 27. PECAN CHRISTMAS CAKE
info:
PECAN CHRISTMAS CAKE

ingredients

2 c. butter
2 c. sugar
6 eggs
1 Tbsp. vanilla
1 1/2 c. golden raisins
4 c. chopped pecans
3 c. all-purpose flour
1/4 tsp. salt
1 tsp. baking powder

preparation

Cream butter and sugar. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Add vanilla. Mix raisins, nuts and 1/4 cup flour. Sift remaining dry ingredients. Alternately fold in raisins, pecan mixture and dry ingredients into creamed mixture. Spoon into greased and paper lined pan. Bake at 300° for 1 hour and 50 minutes in 10-inch tube pan. Cool and remove from pan.

title: 246. OLD TIME CHRISTMAS SALAD (SLAW)
info:
OLD TIME CHRISTMAS SALAD (SLAW)

ingredients

1 (15 oz.) can baby lima beans (Veg-All brand is good)
1 (15 oz.) can tiny English peas (LeSueur brand is good)
1 med. cabbage
1 (7 oz.) bottle horseradish
1 c. mayonnaise or salad dressing
1 tsp. salt

preparation

Grate cabbage on coarse side of grater. Drain peas and beans thoroughly. Mix cabbage, peas and beans together and add 7 tablespoons of horseradish (or more to taste) and mayonnaise. Store in refrigerator until ready to serve. Will keep for several days. Garnish with olives or sliced pimentos.

title: 118. CORN FLAKE CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES
info:
CORN FLAKE CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES
(Holiday)

ingredients

3 Tbsp. butter, melted
40 large marshmallows
green food coloring
6 c. corn flakes
"Red Hot" candies

preparation

Melt butter over medium heat. Stir in marshmallows until melted. Add green food coloring. Turn off heat and add corn flakes. Fold into mixture with a spoon. Run hands under cold water and form wreaths on wax paper. Place red hots on top to look like berries and let stand until firm.

title: 69. CHRISTMAS PUDDING CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS PUDDING CAKE

ingredients

1 whole orange
1 cup raisins
1 cup sugar
2 Tbsp. butter
1 egg
2 cups flour
1 tsp. baking soda
1/2 tsp. salt
1 cup sour milk (buttermilk)

preparation

Grind the entire orange and the raisins (use the orange peel too). Mix the ground mixture with the sugar, butter, egg, flour, soda, salt, and milk.

Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

Mix 1/2 cup orange juice and 1/2 cup sugar. Pour over the cake while still warm.

title: 256. CHRISTMAS NUT THIN COOKIE
info:
CHRISTMAS NUT THIN COOKIE

ingredients

1 c. butter
1 c. sugar
1 1/2 c. flour
2 eggs
1 c. nuts, chopped
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 tsp. salt

preparation

Mix sugar and butter together, mix well. Add well beaten eggs, sift in flour and salt, add nuts and vanilla. Mix until smooth and light. Drop on greased baking sheet. Space well apart. Place half nut meat in center of each cookie. Bake at 375° about 10 minutes.

title: 173. SPARKLING CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
SPARKLING CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

4 c. sugar
2 pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
2 pkg. cherry Kool-Aid
1 (46 oz.) unsweetened pineapple juice
1 (46 oz.) unsweetened orange juice
2 or more bottles ginger ale

preparation

Combine first 5 ingredients in large container. Mix well until sugar and Kool-Aid dissolve completely. Add 2 bottles of ginger ale for each 4 cups concentrate in punch bowl. May freeze concentrate.

title: 129. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

2 c. light brown sugar
2 eggs
4 c. plain flour
1 c. oleo
2/3 c. buttermilk
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. soda
2 tsp. vanilla
1 lb. chopped dates
1/2 lb. candied cherries, chopped
1/2 lb. candied pineapple, chopped
1 (7 oz.) pkg. flaked coconut
3 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Mix sugar and oleo, then add eggs. Dredge chopped fruit with flour. Put soda in buttermilk and mix all together. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes until slightly brown.

title: 172. CHRISTMAS SOUFFLE
info:
CHRISTMAS SOUFFLE

ingredients

5 egg whites, beaten stiff
1/2 c. sugar
pinch of salt
1/2 c. seeded raisins, cut in pieces
1/2 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Beat egg whites and salt until stiff. Gradually add the sugar, beating constantly. Mix the raisins and nuts together and fold into the egg whites. Pour mixture into buttered baking dish and set dish in pan of hot water. Bake in a moderately slow oven (325°) about 30 minutes. Serve at once.

title: 44. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD
(3 Layer Salad)

Layer 1:

ingredients

1 c. boiling water
1/2 c. cold water
1 (3 oz.) box lime jello
small jar maraschino cherries, drained

preparation

Mix lime jello with boiling water; dissolve. Then add 1/2 c. cold water; let get syrupy. Add maraschino cherries; pour in mold and jell.

Layer 2:

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) box lemon jello
1 c. boiling water
1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese

preparation

Mix lemon jello with boiling water; dissolve. Add cream cheese; let get syrupy. Add to the first layer and jell that layer.

Layer 3:

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) box strawberry jello
1 c. boiling water
1/2 c. cold water
1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained

preparation

Mix strawberry jello with boiling water; dissolve. Add cold water; let it get syrupy. Add drained crushed pineapple; pour over lemon layer. Congeal for several hours. Turn out of mold on platter.

title: 48. CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER
info:
CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER

ingredients

1 large head cauliflower (florets)
1/4 c. diced green pepper
1 (7.3 oz.) jar sliced mushrooms, drained
1/4 c. butter or margarine
1/3 c. all-purpose flour
2 c. milk
1 c. (4 oz.) shredded Swiss cheese
2 Tbsp. diced pimientos
1 tsp. salt
paprika

preparation

In large saucepan, cook cauliflower in a small amount of water 6 to 7 minutes until crisp-tender; drain well. In medium saucepan, sauté green pepper and mushrooms in butter 2 minutes. Add flour. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Add pimientos and salt. Place half of cauliflower in a greased 2-quart baking dish. Top with half of sauce. Repeat layers. Bake at 325° for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika.

title: 294. CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS

ingredients

1 pkg. 24 frozen rolls
1 box cook and serve butterscotch pudding
1/2 c. butter or margarine
3/4 tsp. cinnamon
3/4 c. brown sugar

preparation

Place rolls in greased tube pan. Sprinkle dry pudding over rolls. Cook butter, brown sugar and cinnamon until it bubbles and sugar dissolves. Pour over rolls. Cover tightly with foil and let sit on counter overnight, or 6 - 8 hours. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Invert onto serving plate.

title: 137. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 can pineapple juice
2 cans frozen orange juice, will make 2 qt
2 pkg strawberry kool aid, will make 4 qt

preparation

Mix ingredients. Add 2 qt chilled ginger ale before serving. Top with pineapple sherbet.
