title: 226. CHRISTMAS ROCKS
info:
CHRISTMAS ROCKS

ingredients

4 eggs
3 sticks butter
1 1/4 c. sugar
3 c. flour
1/2 tsp. cinnamon
1/2 tsp. nutmeg
1/2 tsp. ground cloves
3 tbsp. orange juice
1 lb. candied cherries
1 lb. candied pineapple
2 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Chop cherries, pineapple and pecans. Pour orange juice over fruit and let stand 1 hour. Sprinkle 1 1/2 c. flour over fruit & nut mixture. Mix eggs, butter, sugar, 1 1/2 c. flour, cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves. Add fruit mixture and mix well. Spoon onto cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees until edges are brown. Cookies will be soft.

title: 113. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1/2 c. butter
1/2 c. shortening
1 1/2 c. sugar
2 eggs
1 tsp. vanilla
2 tsp. baking powder
3 c. flour

preparation

Mix butter, shortening, sugar, eggs and vanilla thoroughly. Add dry ingredients, mix until the dough is firm enough to handle. This can be used in a cookie press or rolled out and cut with cookie cutters. Decorate with powdered sugar frosting.

title: 203. CHRISTMAS MORNING STICKY BUNS
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING STICKY BUNS

ingredients

1/2 Cup Chopped Pecans or Walnuts
1 (25 oz.) Package Frozen Roll Dough, Thawed
1 (3.4 oz.) Package Butterscotch instant Pudding Mix
1/2 Cup Butter or Margarine, Melted
1/2 Cup Firmly Packed Brown Sugar
3/4 tsp. Ground Cinnamon

preparation

Sprinkle nuts in the bottom of a buttered 12 cup bundt pan. Arrange dough in pan; sprinkle with dry pudding mix. Stir together butter, brown sugar and cinnamon; pour over rolls. Cover and chill 8 hours.

Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Invert into a serving plate and serve immediately.

title: 106. CHRISTMAS COOKIE BALLS
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIE BALLS

ingredients

6 c. flour
1 lb. butter
4 Tbsp. powdered sugar
1 1/2 c. nuts
1/2 tsp. salt

preparation

Mix flour, butter, nuts and salt; form balls. Bake 20 to 25 minutes at 325°. Cool and roll in powdered sugar.

title: 18. CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS

ingredients

1 bag (24) frozen dinner rolls
1 (3 3/4 oz.) pkg. butterscotch pudding mix (not instant)
1/2 c. butter
3/4 c. brown sugar
3/4 tsp. cinnamon
1/2 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Arrange rolls in greased, fluted tube pan. Sprinkle dry pudding mix over rolls. Cook butter and remaining ingredients over low heat until mixture bubbles; pour over rolls.

Cover tightly with foil and let stand on countertop overnight. Next morning, bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes, then invert carefully onto serving dish.

title: 78. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

2 small pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid
2 c. sugar
2 qts. water
1 lg. can pineapple juice
1 qt. ginger-ale
1/2 gal. pineapple sherbet

preparation

Mix all ingredients; adding sherbet last.

title: 73. GRAM CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
GRAM CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

2 pkg. strawberry Kool-Aid, chilled
2 cans Hawaiian Punch, chilled
3 liters ginger ale, chilled
2 qt. rainbow sherbet

preparation

Premix Kool-Aid according to directions on pack. Makes 1 gallon. Pour 1/2 Kool-Aid in punch bowl. Add 1/2 ginger ale and 1/2 sherbet. This will make 2 punch bowls full.

title: 49. CHRISTMAS BREAD WREATH
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAD WREATH

Frosting:

ingredients

2 c. powdered sugar
1/2 tsp. almond flavoring
milk (small amount)
nut halves
candied cherries (both red and green)

preparation

Place defrosted bread in oiled bowl and cover with tea towel. Let rise in warm place 3 to 4 hours. Punch down (do not knead). Stretch onto an oiled cookie sheet to approximately 8 1/2 x 12-inch rectangle. Spread with soft butter or oleo. Sprinkle with brown sugar, white sugar, cinnamon, raisins, ground nuts and candied fruits. Roll like a jelly roll. Wet hands and pinch ends together securely, making a large ring. Cut with scissors every 1/2-inch around the ring. Using hands, twist each section to lay flatter and hide the cookie sheet. Let rise until almost double in warm place. Bake 1/2 hour at 350° until lightly browned.

Immediately frost with the powdered sugar, almond flavoring and small amount of milk. Decorate the top with nut halves and candied cherries. Put a large candle in the middle. Light candle and serve on large round platter.

title: 243. CHRISTMAS POT POURRI
info:
CHRISTMAS POT POURRI

ingredients

3 cinnamon sticks
3 bay leaves
1/4 cup cloves
1/2 orange, cut up
1/2 lemon, cut up
2 to 4 cups water

preparation

Cook on stove at simmer, makes your house smell great. May be kept in refrigerator in closed jar.

title: 38. CHRISTMAS TREE SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS TREE SALAD

ingredients

1 box lime Jello
1 can crushed pineapple
1 (8 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese (softened)
1 c. Cool Whip
1/2 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Dissolve Jello in 1 cup boiling water. Let cool. Add Philadelphia cream cheese, pineapple and Cool Whip. Mix with beater. Add nuts. For tree effect pour salad mixture in coffee cup liners. Gel. Dip in hot water to loosen. Turn upside down on leaf of lettuce. Top with Cool Whip. Place a Maraschino cherry on top of tree for effect, or pour into small square pan.

title: 258. WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE

ingredients

1 Tbsp. unflavored Knox gelatine, softened in 1/4 c. cold water and set aside
1/2 c. sugar
4 Tbsp. flour
1/2 tsp. salt
1 1/2 c. milk
1/4 tsp. vanilla
1/4 tsp. almond extract
1/2 c. heavy whipping cream
3 egg whites, beaten with 1 tsp. cream of tartar
1/2 c. more sugar
1 c. moist coconut
1 (9-inch) pastry shell, baked

preparation

In saucepan, combine 1/2 cup sugar, flour and salt. Gradually stir in milk. Cook over low heat until boils 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in gelatine. Beat until smooth. Cool. Blend in flavors. Fold in whipped cream (already whipped) and carefully fold in meringue, then coconut. Put in baked pastry shell and sprinkle top with coconut. Garnish with maraschino cherries, if desired.

title: 26. DICKENS CHRISTMAS GREAT CAKE
info:
DICKENS CHRISTMAS GREAT CAKE

ingredients

2 1/4 c. sifted cake flour
1 tsp. baking powder
1/4 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. ground nutmeg
1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon
3/4 c. butter
1 1/4 c. sifted confectioners sugar
4 eggs
2 Tbsp. each light corn syrup and water
1/2 c. extra strength coffee
1/2 c. white raisins
1 c. seedless raisins
1 c. currants
1 c. chopped mixed candied fruit
1 c. finely slivered almonds

preparation

Sift flour with baking powder, salt, nutmeg and cinnamon. Cream butter; gradually add sifted confectioners sugar and cream until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition. Then add flour mixture alternately with extra strength coffee, beginning and ending with flour and beating after each addition until smooth (batter will look curdled). Fold in white raisins, seedless raisins, currants, mixed candied fruit and slivered almonds. Spread in well-greased 9-inch tube pan. Bake in moderate 350° oven 30 minutes. Then sprinkle almonds on top of cake. Bake 30 to 35 minutes longer. Simmer corn syrup and water for 1 minute and brush over top of cake to hold almonds in place and to give a gloss. Cool cake 15 minutes in pan, then turn out on rack to finish cooling. Cake will slice best when chilled. Eat at room temperature.

title: 271. IRENE'S CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
IRENE'S CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 lb. dates
1/2 lb. candied cherries
1/2 lb. candied pineapple
1/2 lb. walnuts
1 c. butter
1 1/2 c. sugar
2 eggs
2 1/2 c. flour
1 t. baking soda
1 t. salt
1 t. cinnamon

preparation

Chop the dates, candied cherries and pineapple and walnuts. Cream thoroughly the butter and sugar. Beat in eggs. Add sifted dry ingredients and fruit and nuts. Drop on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 325-350° for 10 minutes.

title: 153. FAVORITE CHRISTMAS OR EASTER CASSEROLE
info:
FAVORITE CHRISTMAS OR EASTER CASSEROLE

ingredients

1 qt. medium white sauce or 4 cans Aunt Penny's White Sauce
1 dozen hard boiled eggs
3 pkg. brown and serve sausage
2 cans sliced mushrooms
1/2 lb. Tillamook cheese
1/4 c. white wine
bread crumbs
chopped parsley
1 Tbsp. prepared mustard
marjoram
pepper
few drops of worcestershire sauce

preparation

Brown and drain sausage. Cut in large pieces. Cut eggs and cheese in large pieces. Season white sauce with marjoram, pepper, few drops of Worcestershire.

Put sausage, egg, cheese and mushrooms into sauce. Put in casserole and top with bread crumbs. Cook on high in microwave 10 to 12 minutes. Serve on toast or English muffins. Make day before and refrigerate. Serves 8 to 12 people.

Variations: Add curry, onions, bell pepper, sherry, ham or chicken.

title: 148. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

12 oz. Cool Whip
1 large can crushed pineapple, drained
1 c. chopped nuts
1 can cherry or strawberry pie filling
1 can sweetened condensed milk

preparation

Mix all ingredients together. Chill overnight.

title: 55. CHRISTMAS WREATHS
info:
CHRISTMAS WREATHS

ingredients

40 large marshmallows or 4 c. small marshmallows
1/2 c. butter
1 tsp. vanilla
few drops green food coloring
4 1/2 c. corn flakes
red cinnamon candies
1/2 tsp. salt

preparation

Melt butter and marshmallows. Add salt, vanilla and coloring. Pour over corn flakes. Drop by spoon onto waxed paper. Decorate with red candies. Let set 24 hours.

title: 127. CHRISTMAS PECAN CANDY CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS PECAN CANDY CAKE

ingredients

1/2 lb candied red cherries (1 1/2 cups cut in quarters)
1/2 lb candied pineapple (1 Cup) coarsely chopped
1/2 lb pitted dates (1 1/2 cups), coarsely snipped
1 Tbsp all purpose flour
1 1/3 cups or 1 lb chopped, shelled pecans
1 can sweetened condensed milk

preparation

Preheat oven to 250°. Grease and flour 9 X 3-inch tube pan with removable bottom. Combine cherries, pineapple, and dates in a very large bowl. Sprinkle with flour; toss to coat well. Add sweetened condensed milk; stir to mix well. Spoon evenly into prepared pan, smoothing the top. Bake in preheated, slow oven for 1 1/2 hours. Cool in pan on rack. Remove from pan and wrap tightly in foil. Refrigerate at least 2 weeks. Slice very thin; slices best when cold.

title: 236. CHRISTMAS SCENT
info:
CHRISTMAS SCENT

ingredients

3 (4-inch) cinnamon sticks
3 bay leaves
1/4 c. whole cloves
1/2 lemon, halved
1/2 orange, halved
1 qt. water

preparation

Combine. Add additional water as needed. May be stored in the refrigerator several days and reused. Yield: 4 cups.

title: 228. CHRISTMAS CHERRY TARTS
info:
CHRISTMAS CHERRY TARTS

ingredients

2/3 c. graham cracker crumbs
2 Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
1 tsp. vanilla extract
1 egg
1/3 c. sugar
24 cherries (from 1 can cherry pie filling)

preparation

Preheat oven to 375°. Grease two 1 3/4-inch tartlet or small cupcake pans. Combine graham cracker crumbs with butter or margarine; press a rounded teaspoonful of crumb mixture into each cupcake pan. Beat cream cheese, vanilla, egg and sugar until well blended. Fill each cupcake pan. Bake 10 minutes. Chill thoroughly. When ready to serve, run a thin knife around each tart and lift out of pan. Top with a pie cherry. Makes 24.

To store: Refrigerate in airtight covered container up to 1 week. Or omit cherry; wrap well, label and date. Freeze up to 3 months. To serve, thaw; top with cherry.

title: 265. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. snowdrift
1 c. packed brown sugar
1 egg
1/4 c. buttermilk
2 c. sifted Red Band self rising flour
1/2 tsp. salt
1 c. chopped pecans
1 c. chopped dates
2 c. candied cherries (1 red, 1 green)

preparation

Mix snowdrift, brown sugar and eggs well. Add buttermilk, sift together dry ingredients and stir into mixture. Add pecans, dates and candied cherries. Chill dough one hour. Drop with teaspoon about 2 inches apart on lightly greased baking sheet. Top cookie with pecan halve or half of cherry. Bake at 400° for 10 - 12 minutes. Makes 4 dozen.

Note: If self-rising flour not used, use plain all-purpose flour and add 1/2 tsp. soda and 1/2 tsp. baking powder.

title: 35. CHEESE CHRISTMAS TREE
info:
CHEESE CHRISTMAS TREE

Tree:

ingredients

2 (8 oz.) pkgs. cream cheese, softened
1/2 c. chopped green onions
1/2 c. pimento olives chopped
1/4 tsp. garlic powder
4-5 slices dried beef (optional)

preparation

Mix first 5 ingredients together; press out on tray and form "tree."

"Decorations":

ingredients

Green bell pepper for star
Pimentos for garland
Chopped parsley and/or green onions

preparation

Star at top -- cut out of a green bell pepper. Garland -- pimentos zig-zagged from one side to the other. Then sprinkle chopped parsley and/or green onions. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving. The longer it sets, the better it is. (Put toothpicks in it to keep cover off cheese.)

title: 63. CHRISTMAS BREAD
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAD

ingredients

4 c. all-purpose flour, divided
1/2 c. sugar
1 (1/4 oz.) pkg. RapidRise yeast
1 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon
1/2 c. butter or margarine
1/2 c. milk
1 tsp. vanilla extract
2 eggs
3 egg yolks, divided
2/3 c. chopped candied fruit
1/2 c. golden raisins
1 tsp. grated lemon

preparation

Preheat oven to 325°. Butter large bowl; set aside. Butter an 8-inch round cake pan. Line inside of pan with double layer of heavy-duty foil so that foil extends 2-inches above top edge. Secure ends with paper clips. Butter inside of foil.

In large bowl, combine 2 1/2 cups flour, sugar, yeast, salt and cinnamon. In a pot, heat butter, milk, 1/2 cup water and vanilla over low heat until warm (120° to 130°). Add butter mixture to flour mixture. At medium-high speed, beat until combined. Beat in eggs and 2 yolks, one at a time. Stir in candied fruit, raisins and zest. Beat in remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until soft, wet dough forms. Transfer to buttered bowl; cover and let rest 10 minutes. Transfer dough to pan. Cover and let rise in warm place until dough has doubled, about 1 hour.

Beat remaining yolk with 1 teaspoon water; brush over dough. Cut 1/2-inch deep X across center. Bake 55 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool on rack 10 minutes. Remove from pan; cool completely on rack.

title: 71. CHRISTMAS CRUNCH CANDY
info:
CHRISTMAS CRUNCH CANDY

ingredients

1 (12 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips
3/4 c. salted peanuts
3/4 c. raisins
1/2 c. miniature marshmallows

preparation

Melt chocolate chips over simmering water in top of double boiler. Let cool. Stir in salted peanuts, raisins and marshmallows. Line cookie sheet with wax paper. Drop by teaspoonfuls on paper. Refrigerate overnight.

title: 216. OMA'S CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
OMA'S CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

2 tsp. powdered sugar
2 sticks butter or margarine
1 c. chopped nuts
2 c. flour

preparation

Cream butter and sugar together. Add nuts and flour. Make little balls and bake at 350° until done. Roll them in the powdered sugar after they have cooled.

title: 116. CHRISTMAS COOKIE CANES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIE CANES

ingredients

1 c. soft butter
1/2 tsp. salt
2 tsp. vanilla
1/2 c. sifted powdered sugar
2 c. sifted all-purpose flour
1 c. uncooked quick oats
candied cherries, halved

preparation

With electric mixer, cream together butter, salt, vanilla and powdered sugar until light and fluffy. At low speed, add flour and oats until just mixed. Form dough into large or small canes. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Place cherry halves on canes and bake in a preheated 325° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly golden brown.

title: 184. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

pineapple juice
cranberry juice
Sprite

preparation

Mix equal parts pineapple juice, cranberry juice, and Sprite in a large punch bowl.

title: 146. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

2 c. water
1 can (1 lb.) whole cranberry sauce, mashed
2 pkg. (3 oz.) raspberry Jello
1 c. orange sections, well drained
2 c. creamed cottage cheese

preparation

Bring 1 c. water to a boil. Add cranberry sauce and heat until it melts. Add jello and stir. Add 1 c. cold water. Chill until mixture is syrupy. Add orange sections to jello. Pour into ring mold. Chill until firm. Unmold on lettuce leaves and fill center with creamed cottage cheese. One c. canned mandarin oranges can be used.

title: 270. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. brown sugar
1/2 c. butter or oleo
4 eggs
1 tsp. soda
3 Tbsp. milk
1 1/2 lb. pecans
1/2 lb. candied pineapple
1/2 lb. candied cherries
1 glass jelly (plum, grape or apple)
1 lb. white raisins
4 c. flour
1 tsp. each: allspice, cinnamon and nutmeg

preparation

Chop pecans, pineapple and cherries. Use 1 cup flour to coat them. Mix in order given; drop on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 300° about 25 to 30 minutes.

title: 64. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

3 c. flour
1 tsp. baking powder
1/4 tsp. salt
1 1/4 c. sugar
1 c. shortening
3 eggs
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Sift dry ingredients. Add shortening and mix with fork. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix. Roll out thin and cut into desired shapes. Bake at 375° for 8 minutes. Yields 4 dozen.

title: 39. CHRISTMAS GELATIN SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS GELATIN SALAD

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) pkg. strawberry gelatin
1 (3 oz.) pkg. raspberry gelatin
3 c. boiling water
1 c. pineapple juice
1 lb. cranberries, mashed (canned may be used)
1 small apple, chopped
1 (15.5 oz.) crushed pineapple, drained
1 c. sugar
1 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water; add pineapple juice; cool. Combine remaining ingredients and add to gelatin mixture. Pour into an oblong pan; Chill until firm. Cut into squares to serve.

title: 235. CHRISTMAS OPEN HOUSE PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS OPEN HOUSE PUNCH

ingredients

2 c. sugar
1 qt. water
2 pkg. lime Kool-Aid
1 (46 oz.) can pineapple juice
1 qt. ginger ale

preparation

Dissolve water and sugar, add Kool-Aid and pineapple juice. When ready to serve, add the ginger ale.

title: 76. BISCUIT CHRISTMAS TREE
info:
BISCUIT CHRISTMAS TREE

ingredients

2 cans refrigerated biscuits
powdered sugar
green food coloring
maraschino cherries or candied cherries
green colored decorated sugar

preparation

Preheat oven to 450°. Separate biscuits from two cans of biscuits. At center top of ungreased baking sheet, place a biscuit, then make two rows of 2 below, then two rows of 3 and two rows of 4 biscuits, making "tree" shape as you go along. Final biscuit is made into oval and placed at center bottom of base. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Frost while hot with light green powdered sugar glaze. Put large whole maraschino or candied cherries in hollows where biscuits come together and cherry halve on edges and at peak of tree. Sprinkle with green colored sugar.

Recipe can be cut in half for a smaller tree.

title: 295. CHRISTMAS MORNING STICKY BUNS
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING STICKY BUNS

ingredients

1 cup chopped pecans or walnuts
1 package frozen rolls, thawed
1 package butterscotch instant pudding mix
1/2 cup margarine melted
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon

preparation

Sprinkle pecans in bottom of buttered 12 cup Bundt pan. Arrange dough in pan (I cut rolls in half), sprinkle with dry pudding mix. Stir together melted margarine, brown sugar, cinnamon- pour over rolls. Cover and chill for 8 hours. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.

title: 80. CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS WREATH COOKIES

ingredients

1 1/2 c. butter, softened
3/4 c. sugar
1 large egg
3 c. all-purpose flour
1/4 c. orange juice
1 (4 1/4 oz.) tube green decorator frosting
red cinnamon candies

preparation

Beat butter at medium speed of mixer until creamy. Add sugar gradually. Mix well. Add flour and orange juice alternately.

Use cookie gun fitted with proper dish to shape wreaths. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375° for 8 minutes or until edges just begin to turn brown. Remove to wire rack. Cool completely.

Using decorator frosting, shape leaves at one point of wreath cookie. Embed cinnamon candies for berries.

title: 56. CHRISTMAS COOKIES AND ICING
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES AND ICING

ingredients

3 eggs
2 sticks butter
2 cups sugar
1/2 cup evaporated milk
1 tsp. baking soda
1 Tbsp. almond extract, or 2 tsp. nutmeg, or 1 1/2 Tbsp. vanilla
2 tsp. baking powder
7 1/2 cups flour

preparation

Beat eggs. Add butter, sugar, milk and mix. Mix soda and a little water (enough to stir) and add to mixture. Sift flour and baking powder together and blend gradually into cookie mixture. Grease and flour cookie sheets. Roll dough into 1/4 inch thickness and cut with Christmas cookie cutters and place on cookie sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 10-12 minutes.

Icing:

ingredients

2 cups powdered sugar
3 Tbsp. evaporated milk
1 tsp. vanilla
1-3 drops of food coloring

preparation

Sift powdered sugar and stir in milk until mixture reaches icing consistency. Add vanilla extract for flavor and stir. Divide icing into containers and add food coloring to each container to obtain desired colors. Ice cookies after they have cooled. Allow icing to dry before moving cookies.

title: 257. CHRISTMAS CUTOUTS
info:
CHRISTMAS CUTOUTS

ingredients

1 c. shortening
1 c. sugar
1 tsp. baking powder
1 tsp. baking soda
pinch of salt
2 eggs
4 heaping Tbsp. sour cream
3 c. flour

preparation

Roll out cookie dough on floured counter. Cut out cookies. Bake at 375° for 8 minutes.

title: 109. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. soft shortening
2 c. brown sugar
2 eggs
3 1/2 c. flour
1 tsp. soda
1 tsp. salt
1 1/2 c. pecans, broken
2 c. candied cherries
2 c. dates, cut up

preparation

Mix shortening, brown sugar and eggs. Add flour, soda and salt. Then add fruits: cherries and dates, then pecans. Chill at least one hour. Drop by teaspoon 2 inches apart on greased cookie sheet. Bake in 400° oven until lightly browned.

title: 136. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

3 small cans frozen lemonade
1 pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed
1 pkg. lemon Kool-Aid
water and sugar (for Kool-Aid)
1 to 2 qt. ginger ale

preparation

Make lemonade and Kool-Aid as directed. Add in strawberries. Add ginger ale just before serving. Serves 35 to 40.

Preparation time: 5 minutes.

title: 104. CHRISTMAS FANTASY FUDGE
info:
CHRISTMAS FANTASY FUDGE

ingredients

3 c. sugar
3/4 c. butter (1 1/2 sticks)
2/3 c. evaporated milk
1 (12 oz.) pkg. semi-sweet chocolate pieces
1 (7 oz.) jar Kraft Marshmallow Crme
1 c. nuts
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

You will also need 1 candy thermometer.

Using a heavy pot, mix sugar, butter and milk; bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 5 minutes over medium heat or until candy thermometer reaches 238°. Stir constantly; mixture scorches easily. Remove from heat. Stir in chocolate pieces until melted, then add marshmallow, nuts and vanilla; beat well. Pour in greased 9 x 3 pan. Cool and cut into small squares. "Mark off" while still warm.

title: 274. RUBY CHRISTMAS SLUSH
info:
RUBY CHRISTMAS SLUSH

ingredients

1 (6 oz.) can frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed and undiluted
4 1/2 c. water
2 (46 oz.) cans RED fruit punch
1 (46 oz.) can unsweetened pineapple juice
1 (48 oz.) bottle cranapple juice
2 (33.8 oz.) bottles ginger ale, chilled

preparation

Combine thawed orange juice concentrate and water, mixing well. Stir in fruit punch, pineapple juice and cranapple juice. Freeze in a large container stirring occasionally. Remove from freezer 3-4 hours before serving, stirring occasionally as mixture thaws. Stir in ginger ale just before serving. Yield: about 2 1/4 gallons.

title: 278. DADDY'S CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
DADDY'S CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 large can pineapple juice (chilled)
1 large can orange juice (chilled)
1 c. sugar
2 c. hot water
2 pkg. strawberry Kool aid
1-2 liter ginger ale (chilled)

preparation

Melt sugar in water in saucepan. Put pineapple and orange juice in punch bowl. Add sugar, water and Kool aid. Mix well. Then add Ginger ale. Mix and decorate with ice ring.

title: 183. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 46 oz can pineapple juice
1 46 oz can of water
2 c sugar
4 pkg any flavor Kool Aid
1/4 c lemon juice
1 quart ginger ale

preparation

Mix well, all but ginger ale. Add ginger ale just before serving.

title: 108. CHRISTMAS ROCKS
info:
CHRISTMAS ROCKS

ingredients

1 c. margarine
1 1/2 c. brown sugar
1 tsp. cinnamon
1 lb. chopped nuts
1 lb. golden raisins
1 lb. chopped dates
3 jars red cherries
3 jars green cherries
3 eggs
3 c. self-rising flour
1 tsp. soda, dissolved in water

preparation

Mix all dried fruit and nuts in flour. Then mix together with eggs, sugar, cinnamon and margarine. Add drained cherries and soda. Add some juice of red cherries, this adds taste and color. Bake 350° for 12-15 minutes. Let cool.

title: 289. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

1 pkg. lime jello
1 c. boiling water
1 small can crushed pineapple
8 oz. pkg. cream cheese
3/4 c. salad dressing
1/2 c. chopped pecans
1 pkg. strawberry jello
1 c. boiling water
1 c. cold water

preparation

Mix lime jello, boiling water and pineapple. Allow to congeal. Meanwhile, soften cream cheese. Spread cream cheese, salad dressing and pecans over lime mixture and allow to cool. Mix jello and boiling water. Add cold water. After mixture is cool, pour over the layer of cream cheese. This salad is pretty and colorful as well as delicious.

title: 79. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 gal. apple cider
1 c. (red hots) cinnamon candy
1 stick cinnamon
1/4 tsp. powdered cloves

preparation

Bring to a boil. Ready to serve.

title: 254. CHRISTMAS BREAD
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAD

ingredients

8 cups plain flour
2 cups milk
1 tsp. salt
2 packets yeast
1 cup sugar
4 eggs
1 lb. butter flavored shortening
1/2 lb. fruit mix

preparation

Scald milk and add sugar and salt. When luke warm add dry yeast and 2 cups flour. Beat well and let rise for 45 minutes. Mix eggs and shortening and add to yeast mixture. Add remaining flour and fruit. Knead and let rise. Knead again and put into loaves and let rise again. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

title: 84. CRANBERRY CHRISTMAS MOLD
info:
CRANBERRY CHRISTMAS MOLD

ingredients

1 can (13 1/2 oz.) crushed pineapple
water
2 pkg. (3 oz. each) strawberry gelatin
3/4 c. cold water
1 can (16 oz.) jellied cranberry sauce
1/3 c. coarsely chopped pecans
1 Tbsp. butter or margarine

preparation

Drain pineapple juice into measuring cup; reserve pineapple. Add water to juice to make 1 cup. Bring to a boil in saucepan over moderate heat. When boiling, remove from heat, stir in gelatin and stir until dissolved. Add cold water; chill until mixture is consistency of unbeaten egg whites. In medium bowl combine drained pineapple and cranberry sauce; when well mixed stir into gelatin mixture. Pour into 9 inch square pan. Cover and chill until firm. Meanwhile, heat oven to 350°. Place pecans and butter in a shallow pan and bake about 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pecans are toasted. Cool nuts. When gelatin mixture is firm, spread Creamy Cheese Topping over the top. Sprinkle pecans over frosting. Chill 3 to 4 hours until frosting is firm. Using wet knife, cut salad into 9 squares. With small pancake turner lift squares onto a serving plate. Chill until serving time. Decorate with salad greens if desired. Makes 9 servings.

Creamy Cheese Topping:

ingredients

1 pkg. (3 1/2 oz.) vanilla flavored whipped dessert mix
1/2 c. heavy cream
1/2 c. milk
1 pkg. (3 oz.) cream cheese, at room temperature

preparation

Place the whipped dessert mix in small bowl of electric mixer. Prepare according to package directions but substitute 1/2 cup heavy cream for the milk and 1/2 cup milk for the water. When mixed add the cream cheese and blend well. Use to frost Cranberry Christmas Salad.

title: 19. CHRISTMAS COFFEE CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS COFFEE CAKE

ingredients

2 1/4 oz. pkg. dry active yeast
1/2 c. warm water
1 1/2 c. butter, softened
1 c. sugar
1 doz. egg yolks
5 c. flour
3/4 tsp. salt
1 1/2 c. scalded milk
1 1/2 c. golden raisins
1 c. slivered almonds
confectioners sugar

preparation

Dissolve yeast in water. Cream butter and sugar. Slowly add egg yolks and beat well. Add yeast mixture to batter. Combine flour and salt. Beat slowly into the batter, alternating with the scalded milk. Coat raisins in flour to prevent "sinking" in batter. Add raisins and almonds to batter. Divide into three 1 1/2-quart tube pans. Each pan should be 1/2 full. To rise, cover and let sit in a warm place for 3 hours. Batter will almost double in size. Bake at 325° for 35 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Remove cakes from the pans and sprinkle with confectioners sugar. Yield: 3 pans.

title: 178. CHRISTMAS BIRD SEED
info:
CHRISTMAS BIRD SEED

ingredients

15 oz pkg Sugar Smacks
16 oz pkg M&M's
16 oz pkg Raisins
16 oz pkg Roasted Peanuts

preparation

Mix all ingredients well. Store in airtight container.

title: 264. SEVEN LAYER CHRISTMAS RIBBON CAKE
info:
SEVEN LAYER CHRISTMAS RIBBON CAKE

Layers:

ingredients

1 box Duncan Hines yellow cake mix

preparation

Mix as directed on box. Add different cake coloring to each layer. Can use 2 layers of green, red, chocolate and leave one plain as long as you alternate layers. Pour thin layers of batter onto 8-inch skillet, about enough to cover bottom of pan and bake in 500° to 550° oven for about 2 1/2 to 3 minutes per layer. Spray skillet with nonstick spray each time. An 8-inch cake pan may be used to cook layers.

Chocolate Icing:

ingredients

2 c. sugar
1/2 c. milk
1 stick butter or margarine
3 Tbsp. cocoa
1/2 tsp. vinegar (vinegar will keep sugar from crystallizing)

preparation

Mix together and bring to a boil. Cook 1 minute. Add teaspoon vanilla extract. Ice each layer of cake.

title: 96. CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER
info:
CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER

ingredients

1 large head cauliflower broken into florets
1/4 c. diced bell pepper
1 jar (7.3 oz.) sliced mushrooms, drained
1/4 c. butter
1/3 c. all purpose flour
2 c. milk
1 c. (4 oz.) shredded swiss cheese
2 Tbsp. diced pimentos
1 tsp. salt

preparation

In a large saucepan cook cauliflower in a a small amount of water for 6 to 7 minutes until crisp and tender. Drain well. In a medium saucepan sauté bell peppers and mushrooms in butter for 2 minutes. Add flour and gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil and boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in cheese until melted. Add pimentos and salt. Place half of the cauliflower in a greased 2 quart baking dish. Top with half of sauce. Repeat layers. Bake uncovered at 325 degrees for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with paprika if desired.

Yields 8 to 10 servings.

title: 276. CHRISTMAS WREATHS
info:
CHRISTMAS WREATHS

ingredients

4 cups frosted flakes
1 1/2 sticks margarine
1 bag large marshmallows
1 tsp. vanilla
2 tsp. green food coloring
cinnamon candies

preparation

In 5 qt. Dutch oven melt margarine and marshmallows. Mix in vanilla and food color. Stir in frosted flakes until well coated. Spoon onto greased pan and decorate with 3 cinnamon candies. May also make 1 large wreath.

title: 250. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

8 to 10 c. lettuce
1 avocado, thinly sliced
1/4 c. red onion, thinly sliced
1/2 c. dried cranberries
1 large can mandarin oranges, drained
4 Tbsp. cranberry juice concentrate
4 Tbsp. rice wine vinegar
1 1/2 tsp. Dijon mustard
1/4 tsp. freshly ground pepper
1/2 c. canola or vegetable oil

preparation

Toss lettuce, avocado, red onion, cranberries and mandarin oranges together. Mix cranberry juice concentrate, rice wine vinegar, mustard, pepper and oil. Pour over salad and toss.

title: 17. CHRISTMAS BRAID
info:
CHRISTMAS BRAID

ingredients

1 (16 oz.) loaf frozen bread dough
2 Tbsp. butter or margarine, softened
1/4 c. brown sugar
1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon
1/4 c. chopped pecans
1 c. confectioners sugar
4 to 5 tsp. milk
red sugar
pecan halves

preparation

Thaw frozen dough; roll to 12-inch square. Cut in 3 strips. Spread butter or margarine down lengthwise center of each strip. Combine brown sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over butter. Top with chopped pecans. Bring dough up around filling, sealing edges to form 3 ropes. Place on greased baking sheet and loosely braid. Let rise until double (about 30 minutes). Bake at 375° for 30 to 35 minutes. Combine confectioners sugar and enough milk to make a thin glaze. Drizzle over braid while it is still warm. Sprinkle top with red sugar and trim with pecan halves.

title: 81. CHRISTMAS PEPPER JELLY
info:
CHRISTMAS PEPPER JELLY

ingredients

2 c. ground sweet red & green peppers
1/2 c. ground seeded jalapeno peppers
6 c. sugar
1 1/2 c. cider vinegar
6 oz. liquid pectin
green food coloring optional

preparation

Combine peppers and divide into 2 parts. In 1/2 of the peppers stir in 1 c. of sugar. In a saucepan, combine the peppers and sugar mixture with vinegar and the remaining sugar; boil this for 10 minutes. Add the other 1/2 of the peppers and pectin; boil for an additional 10 minutes. Pour into jars and seal. Serve over crackers with cream cheese. Yield: 8 cups.

title: 290. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) pkg. lime jello
1 c. boiling water
3/4 c. cold water
1 (5 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained
8 oz. Philadelphia cheese
pecans or walnuts
1 (3 oz.) pkg. cherry jello

preparation

Prepare jello with boiling water and cold water. Add pineapple. Pour into 9 x 12 dish and refrigerate until set. To the cream cheese (room temperature), add milk and mix until like soft butter. Spread over lime jello and chill thoroughly.

Meanwhile, make cherry jello; cool until syrupy. Pour over layer of cheese. Chill. Cut into squares to serve.

Change color of jello for other holidays.

title: 67. CHRISTMAS WREATHS
info:
CHRISTMAS WREATHS

ingredients

1/2 c. butter
1 (10 oz.) pkg. marshmallows
1 tsp. green food coloring
6 cups cornflakes
Red cinnamon candies or red Mini M&M's

preparation

Melt butter in saucepan over low heat. Add marshmallows. cook until marshmallows melt and mixture is syrupy, stirring constantly. Remove from heat.

Add food coloring. Blend well. Add cornflakes. Stir until coated. Divide into 1/4 c. portions on wax paper. Shape into wreaths with buttered fingers. Decorate with red candies. Let stand until cool. (May press entire warm mixture into an 8 cup buttered ring mold to make a large wreath.)

title: 130. CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY
info:
CHRISTMAS HARD CANDY

ingredients

3 1/2 c. sugar
1 c. light corn syrup
1 c. water
1/4 to 1/2 tsp. peppermint oil
1 tsp. red or green food coloring

preparation

In a large heavy saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup and water. Cook on medium heat until candy thermometer reads 300° (hard-crack stage), stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in oil and food coloring. Pour onto a greased cookie sheet. Cool. Break into pieces.

Peppermint oil is available in cake decorating and candy supply stores.

title: 225. CHRISTMAS WREATHS
info:
CHRISTMAS WREATHS

ingredients

1/2 c. margarine
1 tsp. vanilla
5 c. corn flakes
35 lg. marshmallows
1 1/2 tsp. green food coloring

preparation

Melt margarine with marshmallows and add vanilla and food coloring. Pour over corn flakes and mix. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Put red hots or cherry halves in middle to form wreaths. Chill 40 minutes. Makes 2 dozen.

title: 164. CHRISTMAS FRUIT COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS FRUIT COOKIES

ingredients

1 1/2 c. chopped dates
1/4 lb. chopped candied cherries
2 slices chopped candied pineapple
3 c. chopped pecans
3/4 c. brown sugar
1/2 c. white sugar
1/4 tsp. salt
1 c. flour
3 beaten egg whites
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 c. margarine, melted

preparation

Mix fruit, nuts, flour, sugars and salt. Add beaten egg whites and vanilla. Mix well. Add melted margarine and mix again. Grease and flour cookie sheets. Drop mixture by scant teaspoonful on cookie sheets. Bake at 325° for 15 minutes until golden brown. Store baked cookies in airtight container. Yield: 4 dozen.

title: 209. CHRISTMAS BREAD
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAD

ingredients

1 loaf frozen shiite bread
1/3 c. powdered sugar
3 tbsp. softened butter
1/2 c. chopped walnuts, almonds or pecans
1/4 c. chopped candied cherries
1/4 c. seedless raisins
1/2 tbsp. lemon extract

preparation

Thaw and soften dough. In a small mixing bowl, cream together the powdered sugar and butter. Mix in nuts, cherries, raisins and lemon extract. Set aside. Roll dough into a 14x8 inch rectangle. Spread filling to within 1 inch of edge. Beginning from the longest side, roll dough in jelly roll fashion. Pinch to seal seam. Place on a greased baking sheet with seam side down. Cut slashes alternately to the right and the left. Turn each slice on its side to show the filling. Cover, let rise until doubled in size. Bake in preheated oven at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done. Cool on a wire rack. If desired, garnish with red and green candied cherries.

title: 247. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

6 chopped (unpeeled, red) apples
1 #2 can crushed or small tidbits pineapple (drain, reserve juice)
1 pkg. miniature marshmallows
3 eggs, beaten
1 c. sugar
1 tsp. mustard
pineapple juice (reserved from pineapple)
juice from one lemon
dash of salt
3 Tbsp. flour

preparation

Combine apples, drained pineapple and marshmallows. Set aside. Cook the remaining ingredients, include the reserved pineapple juice, until thick. Allow the mixture to cool and pour over fruit. Do not mix. Top with coconut.

title: 57. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. butter or margarine
1 1/2 c. sugar
3 eggs
3 c. flour
1 tsp. cinnamon
1 tsp. soda
pinch of salt
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 lb. pineapple (4 slices)
1/2 lb. candied cherries
1 1/2 lb. (qt.) chopped pecans
1/2 lb. dates

preparation

Chop all fruit and nuts. Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time. Sift all flour, salt, cinnamon and soda together. Add flour and vanilla. Gradually stir in all fruit and nuts. Drop from teaspoon on greased cookie sheet and bake 20 minutes at 300°.

title: 114. CHRISTMAS FUDGE
info:
CHRISTMAS FUDGE

ingredients

3 c. sugar
1 1/2 c. light cream
1 c. light corn syrup
1 tsp. salt
2 tsp. vanilla
1 c. diced candied pineapple
1 c. halved candied cherries
1 1/2 c. broken walnuts
1 1/2 c. shaved Brazil nuts
2 c. pecan halves

preparation

Combine sugar, cream, corn syrup and salt. Boil to soft ball stage (260°). Add vanilla. Do not cool, but beat immediately with electric mixer until creamy and begins to hold its shape (about 10 minutes). Thoroughly mix in remaining ingredients. Press into buttered 9 X 13 pan. Chill until firm enough ro cut. Let stand 24 hours before serving. This keeps very well.

title: 103. CHRISTMAS PENUCHE
info:
CHRISTMAS PENUCHE
(Original Recipe)

ingredients

1 box brown sugar
3/4 c. butter (1 1/2 sticks)
1 (12 oz.) pkg. butterscotch or peanut butter pieces
1 (7 oz.) jar Marshmallow Crme
1 c. nuts
1 c. white sugar
2/3 c. evaporated milk
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

You will also need 1 candy thermometer.

Using a heavy pot, mix sugar, butter and milk; bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Boil for 7 minutes over medium heat or until candy thermometer reaches 238°. Stir constantly; mixture scorches easily. Remove from heat. Stir in butterscotch or peanut butter pieces until melted. Then add marshmallow, nuts and vanilla; beat well. Pour in greased 9 x 3 pan. Cool and cut into small squares. "Mark off" while still warm.

Christmas Penuche (Variation On Recipe):

ingredients

1 stick butter
1/3 c. canned milk
1/2 tsp. vanilla
1 (12 oz.) pkg. chocolate or butterscotch chips
1 c. each: peanut butter, nuts and coconut
2 c. brown sugar
marshmallows

preparation

Cook and boil for 5 minutes. Add chips, peanut butter, nuts and coconut to mixture. Pour in pan. Cool and cut.

title: 187. HAZEL'S CHRISTMAS PICKLES
info:
HAZEL'S CHRISTMAS PICKLES

ingredients

4 tbsp salt
6 tbsp pickling spice
4 tbsp alum
4 c. vinegar

preparation

Fill a one gallon glass jar with small to medium cucumbers which have been thoroughly washed. Add all the preceding ingredients and finish filling the jar with water. Put lid on and shake well, let stand in cool place till December, (standing longer will not affect quality). Open jar; drain and wash pickles. Cut into bite size chunks and put back into jar. Dissolve 7 cups of sugar in a quart of water and pour over cucumbers. If necessary, add more water to cover pickles; let stand for 2 weeks in the refrigerator.

title: 185. CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS
info:
CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS

ingredients

2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
1 (4 oz.) pkg. Ranch salad dressing mix
1/2 c. sweet red pepper, minced
1/2 c. celery, minced
1/4 c. green onions, sliced
1/4 c. stuffed olives, sliced
3 to 4 (10 inch) flour tortillas

preparation

In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and dressing mix until smooth. Add red pepper, celery, green onions and olives; mix well. Spread about 3/4 cup on each tortilla. Roll up tightly; wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Slice into 1/2 inch pieces.

title: 296. CHRISTMAS ANISE DROPS
info:
CHRISTMAS ANISE DROPS

ingredients

1 1/2 c. sifted flour
1/4 tsp. baking powder
2 eggs
1 c. sugar
1/4 tsp. anise flavoring

preparation

Generously grease cookie sheets.

Sift together and set aside the flour and baking powder. Put eggs into a liquid measuring cup. Add water, if necessary (enough to make 1/2 cup liquid). Put into a mixing bowl with sugar and anise flavoring.

Beat until very thick and piled softly. Fold in the dry ingredients, sifting in about 1/4 at a time. Use a pastry bag or drop by teaspoonfuls onto the cookie sheets, about 2-inches apart. Set cookie sheets aside in a cool place (not in refrigerator) 8 to 10 hours or overnight. Do not cover cookies and do not disturb!

Bake at 350° for 5 to 6 minutes. Remove to cooling racks to cool completely. Cookies form a cake like layer on the bottom with a crisp "frosting" on the top. Makes about 4 dozen.

Recipe may be doubled.

title: 90. CHRISTMAS FRUIT SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS FRUIT SALAD

ingredients

3 egg yolks, beaten
3 Tbsp. water
3 Tbsp. vinegar
1/2 tsp. salt
2 c. whipped cream
3 c. miniature marshmallows
2 c. halved green grapes
1 (20 oz.) an pineapple tidbits, drained
1 (11 oz.) can mandarin oranges, drained
1 (10 oz.) jar red maraschino cherries, drained and sliced
1 c. chopped pecans
3 Tbsp. lemon juice

preparation

In large saucepan, combine egg yolks, water, vinegar and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens and reaches 160°. Remove from heat. Fold in whipped cream. In large bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Add dressing and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Makes 12 to 14 servings.

title: 260. CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE

ingredients

1 lb butter
1 1/2 lb brown sugar
1 1/2 lbs flour
2 tsp nutmeg
1 tsp mace
1 tsp cloves
2 tsp cinnamon
1 tsp baking soda
3 tsp baking powder
3 lbs raisins
2 lbs currants
1 lb citron, sliced
1 lb dates, sliced
10 eggs, well beaten
1 c molasses
1 c strong cold coffee
Juice and grated rind of 1 lemon
1 c tart jelly
1/4 lb almonds, sliced

preparation

Cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Sift dry ingredients together 3 times and mix with fruit. Add eggs to creamed mixture. Add flour-fruit mixture alternately with next 5 ingredients and beat thoroughly. Pour into pans lined with greased paper. Sprinkle almonds on top. Cover cakes with greased paper. Steam for 2 hours, then bake in slow oven 300° 1 1/2 to 2 hours, removing paper last 1/2 hour to dry surface.

title: 191. CHRISTMAS COKE-CHERRY SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS COKE-CHERRY SALAD

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) pkg. raspberry Jell-O
1 (3 oz.) pkg. cherry Jell-O
1 can cherries or seedless grapes, drained
1 large can crushed pineapple, drained
1 c. pecans, chopped
1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, frozen
2 (6 1/2 oz.) cokes, partially frozen

preparation

Dissolve jello in juice heated from cherries and pineapple. This is all the liquid. Add coke, cherries (or grapes), pineapple and nuts. Grate frozen cream cheese on top. Place in refrigerator. Serve cold.

title: 272. FUDGY CHRISTMAS WREATH
info:
FUDGY CHRISTMAS WREATH

ingredients

1 can sweetened condensed milk (14 oz.)
1 c. nuts, chopped
2 c. (12 oz.) chocolate chips, semisweet or milk chocolate
1/2 tsp. vanilla
red and green maraschino cherries

preparation

In a sauce pan over low heat cook and stir milk and chocolate chips until chocolate melts and mixture is slightly thickened (about 6 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in nuts and vanilla. Cool until it starts to set, about 15 minutes. Line a baking sheet with wax paper. Spoon mixture by 2 tablespoons full into small mounds to form a wreath. Decorate with cherries. You can just pour it out on wax paper and then cut into pieces when firm. Chill until firm. This makes a soft fudge. Keep refrigerated.

title: 239. CHRISTMAS HOT PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS HOT PUNCH

ingredients

3/4 c. brown sugar, packed firmly
1 c. water
1/4 tsp. salt
3/4 tsp. ground cloves
1/2 tsp. cinnamon
1/4 tsp. allspice
1 1/2 qt. cranberry juice
46 oz. unsweetened pineapple juice

preparation

Put sugar, water, salt, cloves, cinnamon, allspice and cranberry juice together and bring to boil. Then add pineapple juice. Bring to boil again. Serve.

title: 241. CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST

ingredients

1 lb. sausage
8 slices bread, cubed
2 1/2 c. grated cheese
1 can mushroom soup
4 eggs, beaten
3/4 tsp. dry mustard
3 c. milk

preparation

Brown sausage and layer sausage, bread and cheese in 9 x 13 pan. Mix together mushroom soup, eggs, mustard and milk. Pour over other ingredients and bake for 350° for 1 hour. Top will be raised and slightly brown. Best if fixed night before and baked in the morning.

title: 120. CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS FRUITCAKE

ingredients

1 1/2 lb. nuts (walnuts, pecans or almonds)
1 lb. raisins or dates
1/2 tsp. salt
1 tsp. baking powder
1 c. flour
1/2 c. sugar
4 eggs
1 tsp. vanilla
1 jar maraschino cherries, drained

preparation

Make batter mixing all ingredients but fruit and nuts. Stir in fruit and nuts last. Pour into lightly greased pans and bake at 300° for following time: two 9 x 5-inch loaf pans, bake for 1 hour and 45 minutes; eight 4 x 2-inch pans, bake for 55 minutes and for 48 tart size pans, bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

title: 157. CHRISTMAS CASSEROLE COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS CASSEROLE COOKIES

ingredients

2 eggs
1 c. sugar
1 c. walnuts
1 c. chopped dates
1 c. flaked coconut
1 tsp. vanilla
1/4 tsp. almond extract

preparation

Beat eggs well and gradually add sugar. Beat until fluffy. Stir in remaining ingredients. Place in a 2-quart casserole. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. While hot, stir well with a wooden spoon. Cool and form into small balls; roll in granulated sugar.

title: 273. CROCK POT CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CROCK POT CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 can (32 oz.) pineapple juice
1 bottle (32 oz.) cranberry juice
1/3 c. red-hot candies
1 cinnamon stick (3-1/2 inch)
Additional cinnamon sticks, optional

preparation

In a crockpot, combine juices, red-hot candies and cinnamon stick. Cook on low for 2-5 hours. Remove cinnamon stick(s) before serving. Yields 2 quarts.

title: 279. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 Pkg. Cherry or Raspberry Kool-Aid
2 C. Water
1 1/2 to 2 C. Sugar
1/4 to 1/2 of (2 liter) bottle 7-UP
7 to 8 Scoops Vanilla Ice Cream

preparation

Mix all ingredients in order listed in punch bowl.

Makes about one gallon.

title: 229. CHRISTMAS PIE
info:
CHRISTMAS PIE

ingredients

1 can cherry or strawberry pie filling
1 can crushed pineapple
2 Tbsp. cornstarch
2 c. sugar
1 small pkg. orange jello
1 or 2 bananas (sliced)
1 c. pecans (optional)
2 graham cracker crust pie shells

preparation

Mix pie filling, pineapple and sugar in saucepan. Add cornstarch and boil until thick. Remove from heat and add jello, mixing well. Let mixture completely cool, then add bananas and pecans. Pour into unbaked graham cracker crust. Makes two regular pies. May top with cool whip.

title: 21. WHITE CHRISTMAS FUDGE
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS FUDGE

ingredients

2 1/4 c. sugar
1/2 c. dairy sour cream
1/4 c. milk
2 Tbsp. butter
1 Tbsp. light corn syrup
1/4 tsp. salt
2 tsp. vanilla
1 c. coarsely chopped walnuts

preparation

Combine sugar, sour cream, milk, butter, corn syrup and salt in heavy 2-quart saucepan. Stir over moderate heat until sugar is dissolved and mixture reaches a boil. Boil over moderate heat 9 to 10 minutes to 238°, soft-ball stage. Remove from heat and allow to stand until lukewarm (110°), about an hour. Add vanilla and beat until mixture just begins to lose its gloss and hold its shape. Quickly stir in walnuts and turn into oiled pan. Let stand until firm before cutting. Makes 1 1/2 pounds.

title: 261. CHRISTMAS CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS CAKE

ingredients

1 white cake mix
2 pkg. instant pistachio pudding
4 eggs
1/2 c. chopped nuts
1/2 c. oil
1 c. club soda
1/2 c. cherries

preparation

Beat cake mix, eggs, oil and pudding for 4 minutes, gradually adding the soda. Add nuts and cherries. Bake at 350° for 1 hour in a well-greased tube pan.

title: 140. CHRISTMAS SPREAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SPREAD

ingredients

1 pkg. chipped beef
1 egg
1 can tomato paste
1 onion
1/4 lb. velveeta cheese
crackers

preparation

Put beef through grinder. Place in double boiler with egg, cheese and tomato paste. Cook until mixed. Chill spread. When ready to serve, spread on crackers.

title: 144. CHRISTMAS CONGEALED SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS CONGEALED SALAD

ingredients

1 large lime jello
1 large Cool Whip
1 large cottage cheese
1 medium can crushed pineapple, drained
1 c. chopped pecans
2 c. coconut
1 c. cherries, chopped

preparation

Mix all ingredients in the order listed and mix well. Cool overnight in refrigerator.

title: 70. CHRISTMAS CUSTARD
info:
CHRISTMAS CUSTARD

ingredients

3 qt. milk
3 boxes vanilla instant pudding
1 pt. whipping cream
1 1/2 c. sugar
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Mix pudding with pint of milk and beat with mixer 5 minutes. Add cream (unwhipped) and beat 3 minutes. Add other ingredients and mix well while scraping side of the bowl. Refrigerate.

title: 227. CRISPY CHRISTMAS TREES
info:
CRISPY CHRISTMAS TREES

ingredients

2 tbsp. butter
2 c. pastel or regular mini marshmallows
3 c. rice crispies
1/4 c. finely chopped pecans
green decorator sugar
powdered sugar

preparation

Melt butter in sauce pan. Stir in marshmallows. Cook and stir over low heat til melted. Remove from heat; stir in cereal & pecans. Let cool just enough to handle with greased hands. Shape into trees or cones. Roll in green sugar. Looks really festive on a silver tray with powdered sugar dusted on them & the tray.

title: 292. CHRISTMAS BREAD
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAD

ingredients

1 pkg. active Bakers yeast (14 oz.)
3/4 c. warm water
3/4 c. evaporated milk
1/3 c. sugar
1/3 c. shortening
1/2 tsp. salt
2 large eggs
4 c. flour (extra flour may be needed)
1 c. chopped mixed candied fruit
1 c. confectioners sugar
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Dissolve yeast in water. Add evaporated milk, sugar, shortening, salt and 2 cups flour. Beat until smooth. Stir in fruit and enough remaining flour to form a soft dough. Do not knead. Place in greased bowl, turning once to grease top. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 1/4 hours. Punch down. Turn onto a floured surface; knead 3 to 4 minutes. Pat evenly into a greased 10-inch tube pan. Cover and let rise in a warm place until nearly double in size, about 45 minutes. Bake at 375° for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pan to cool on a wire rack. Combine confectioners sugar, milk and vanilla; drizzle over bread. Garnish with candied fruit, if desired. Servings: 1.

title: 214. MERRY CHRISTMAS FREEZE
info:
MERRY CHRISTMAS FREEZE

ingredients

3 c. cranberries, finely chopped
1 1/2 c. sugar
1 (8 1/2 oz.) crushed pineapple (undrained)
1/2 c. nuts, chopped
1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
2 c. Cool Whip, thawed

preparation

Mix all ingredients until well blended. Pour into slightly greased mold. Freeze. Garnish with mint leaves and serve with holiday dinners.

title: 167. RED CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
RED CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

2 pts. cranberry juice
1 qt. apple juice
10 (7 oz.) bottles of 7-UP
2 trays 7-Up ice cubes

preparation

Chill fruit juice and 7-Up. Prepare 7-Up ice cubes by pouring 7-Up into 2 ice trays. Freeze. At serving time, combine cranberry and apple juice in a punch bowl. Slowly pour in 7-Up. Add "ice cubes". Serve. Makes 35 punch cup servings.

title: 288. CHRISTMAS PRETZEL SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS PRETZEL SALAD

ingredients

2 2/3 c. pretzels, crushed coarsely (use fat, round ones)
1 1/2 sticks oleo, melted
8 oz. cream cheese
1 c. sugar
8 oz. Cool Whip
1 medium can crushed pineapple
10 oz. frozen strawberries
1 (6 oz.) box red jello

preparation

Mix cream cheese, sugar and Cool Whip. Spread over pretzels. Drain (save juice) from pineapple and strawberries (drain and save juice also). Take liquid off pineapple and strawberries. Add enough water to make 3 cups. Bring to boil. Add jello. Dissolve. Throw in fruit. Put in fridge until set. Pour over cream cheese mixture.

This is pretty for Christmas.

title: 213. CHRISTMAS CATHEDRAL COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS CATHEDRAL COOKIES

ingredients

6 oz. Chocolate chips
1/4 Cup Butter
1 Egg
1 Cup Powdered Sugar
3/4 Cup Nuts or Coconut
3/4 pkg. Colored Miniature Marshmallows

preparation

Melt 6 oz. chocolate chips and 1/4 cup butter in microwave. Cool, add egg well beaten, powdered sugar, marsh mellows. Separate into 2 equal parts. Roll each part in nuts or coconut on wax paper.

Form log- Roll until covered then cover in foil and freeze. Keep frozen until slicing.

title: 123. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. (2 sticks) butter
2/3 c. sugar
1 egg
1 tsp. vanilla
2 1/2 c. flour
1 c. oats

preparation

Beat butter until creamy. Gradually add sugar; beat until fluffy. Add egg; beat until light and fluffy. Blend in vanilla. Gradually add flour to creamed mixture; blend well. Stir in oats. Chill dough. Roll out to 1/8-inch thickness on board or canvas which has been lightly coated with xxx sugar. Cut into desired shapes with floured cookie cutters. Place on buttered cookie sheets. Bake in preheated moderate oven (350°) 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from cookie sheet immediately with metal spatula; cool on wire racks. Decorate with xxx frosting and red and green candied cherries.

title: 223. YUGOSLAVIAN CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
YUGOSLAVIAN CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 cup butter, softened
1 - 1/2 cups sugar, divided
1 egg yolk
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 - 1/2 cups flour
4 egg whites
3/4 cup nuts, chopped
1 teaspoon lemon extract
1 cup blackberry jelly

preparation

Cream butter with 1/2 cup sugar; add egg yolk and salt. Stir in flour. Pat mixture into 10 x 15 inch pan. Stir jelly over dough. Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Add remaining cup of sugar, beating slowly. Fold in most of nut and the lemon extract. Spread meringue over jelly. Top with the rest of the nuts.

title: 62. MIMI'S CHRISTMAS WREATHS
info:
MIMI'S CHRISTMAS WREATHS

ingredients

1/2 c. margarine
1 tsp. vanilla
5 c. corn flakes
35 large marshmallows
1 1/2 tsp. green food coloring

preparation

Melt margarine with marshmallows. Add vanilla and food coloring. Pour over corn flakes and mix. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper. Put "red hots" or cherry halves in middle to form wreath. Chill about 40 minutes. Makes 2 dozen.

title: 220. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. light brown sugar
1 c. butter
4 eggs
3 c. flour
1/2 tsp. salt
1 tsp. soda
1 tsp. cinnamon
2 tsp. vanilla
1 tsp. cherry flavoring
1 lb. pineapple
1 lb. cherries
1 c. white raisins
1 lb. dates
7 c. nuts

preparation

Mix together and drop from teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 275° until light brown. Makes about 200 cookies.

title: 121. CHRISTMAS WREATHS
info:
CHRISTMAS WREATHS

ingredients

1/2 c. lightly salted butter or margarine
1 to 1 1/2 tsp. green food color
4 c. corn flakes
30 large marshmallows
1 1/2 tsp. vanilla extract
Red cinnamon candies

preparation

In a 2 quart saucepan melt butter and marshmallows over moderately low heat, stirring constantly. When melted, remove from heat and stir in 1 tsp. of the food color and the vanilla. Add more food color if desired. Stir in corn flakes. Drop mixture onto waxed paper, 1 Tbsp. at a time. Decorate with red cinnamon candies. Let stand 30 minutes until cool. Makes 40 wreaths.

title: 47. PINEAPPLE-CHEESE CHRISTMAS CASSEROLE
info:
PINEAPPLE-CHEESE CHRISTMAS CASSEROLE

ingredients

2 large cans pineapple chunks
2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
1 c. sugar
6 Tbsp. flour
1 tube Ritz crackers, crushed
4 oz. butter, melted

preparation

Preheat oven to 350°. Mix together pineapple and cheese. Set aside. Mix together sugar and flour. Add to the fruit and cheese mixture. Spread mixture in an 8 x 11-inch or a 9 x 12-inch casserole dish. Spread crushed crackers over top. Pour melted butter over all. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes. Serves 12.

title: 233. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

2 (6 oz.) cans frozen lemonade concentrate
2 (6 oz.) cans frozen limeade concentrate
1 (46 oz.) can unsweetened grapefruit juice
1 (46 oz.) can pineapple juice
1 qt. (32 oz.) water
3 qt. ginger ale
lime sherbet

preparation

Blend juices and water; chill. Add ginger ale just before serving. Float a half gallon of lime sherbet on top of punch mixture.

title: 128. CHRISTMAS SUGAR COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS SUGAR COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. shortening
1 egg
1 c. sugar
1 c. sour cream
2 tsp. vanilla
3 c. flour
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. soda
1/2 tsp. nutmeg (if desired)

preparation

Thoroughly mix shortening, egg, sugar, sour cream and vanilla. Then add flour, salt, soda and nutmeg that have been sifted together. Let dough chill 1 hour in refrigerator. When chilled roll out and cut out with your favorite cutters. Put on aluminum foil lined cookie sheet and bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until lightly brown around edges. Makes 3 1/2 dozen.

title: 125. CHRISTMAS CHERRY CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS CHERRY CAKE

ingredients

18 1/4 box white cake mix
3 oz. cherry gelatin
1 1/2 c. boiling water
8 oz. softened cream cheese
2 c. whipped topping or 8 oz. cool whip
21 oz. can cherry pie filling

preparation

Prepare cake according to package directions, using a greased 13 X 9 X 2 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 35 minutes. Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Cool cake and poke holes in it with a meat fork. Gradually pour gelatin over cake. Cool for 15 minutes then cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. In a mixing bowl beat cream cheese until light. Fold in whipped topping and carefully spread over cake. Top with the pie filling and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving. You may add chopped pecans on top.

title: 110. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 1/2 c. sugar
1 c. shortening
2 eggs
1 c. milk
2 tsp. vinegar
3 c. flour
1 tsp. nutmeg
1 tsp. baking soda
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 tsp. salt

preparation

Cream sugar, shortening, eggs until fluffy. In another bowl, add nutmeg, salt, flour; stir baking soda and vinegar into milk. Then add to dry ingredients with creamed mixture, stirring briskly until well mixed, add vanilla. Drop by teaspoonful on a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375° for 10 minutes. Sprinkle top with red or green colored sugar to decorate.

Very festive during the Holiday Season.

title: 43. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

1 can cherry pie filling
1 small can crushed pineapple, well drained
1 can sweetened condensed milk
1 1/2 c. miniature marshmallows
1 medium container whipped topping
1/2 c. chopped pecans or walnuts

preparation

Mix in order listed. This dessert freezes well.

title: 33. FRESH CHRISTMAS EGGNOG
info:
FRESH CHRISTMAS EGGNOG

ingredients

1 doz. eggs, separated
1 1/2 c. sugar
4 c. milk
1 c. whipping cream, whipped
1/4 c. rum flavoring
1/2 tsp. vanilla extract
1/2 tsp. ground nutmeg

preparation

Beat egg yolks in bowl until smooth. Combine egg yolks and sugar in top of double boiler over hot water. Stir in milk gradually. Cook, stirring constantly, until mixture coats spoon. Remove from heat. Refrigerate until chilled. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites and whipping cream into chilled egg yolk mixture. Stir in rum flavoring. Chill for several hours to blend flavors. Stir in vanilla just before serving; sprinkle with nutmeg. Yield: 24 (1/2 cup) servings.

title: 240. CHRISTMAS DAY PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS DAY PUNCH

ingredients

4 c. apple cider
2 c. orange juice
2 c. cranberry juice
2 broken cinnamon sticks
2 tsp. whole cloves
2 tsp. allspice

preparation

Perk & serve.

title: 102. CHRISTMAS RASPBERRY CAROUSEL
info:
CHRISTMAS RASPBERRY CAROUSEL

ingredients

1 (3 oz.) pkg. raspberry Jell-O
2 c. boiling water
1 c. diced apple
1/4 c. nuts
1 (3 oz.) pkg. lime or lemon Jell-O
1 (4 1/2 oz.) container Cool Whip
1/2 c. mayonnaise
3/4 c. cranberry juice cocktail
1/4 c. diced celery

preparation

You will also need 1 Jell-O mold.

Dissolve raspberry Jell-O in 1 cup of boiling water. Add cranberry juice and chill until slightly thickened (about 1 hour). Fold in apple, celery and nuts and put in ring mold to set.

Dissolve lemon or lime Jell-O in cup of boiling water and chill until slightly thickened. Combine Cool Whip with mayonnaise and fold into lemon or lime Jell-O and spoon into center of mold. Chill until firm. Remove from mold and garnish with salad greens and sliced apples.

title: 259. MERRY CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
MERRY CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 cup brown sugar
1 cup margarine
3 cups flour sifted with 1 tsp cinnamon and 1 tsp allspice
3 eggs, well beaten
1 cup milk
6 slices candied pineapple
2 cups candied cherries, red or green
2 cups chopped dates
7 cups broken pecans

preparation

Cream sugar and margarine. Add beaten eggs. Add milk and flour alternately. Add pineapple, cherries, dates and pecans. Mix all together. (Can use hands.)

Drop by teaspoonsful on greased cookie sheet and bake 18 to 20 minutes at 300.

These freeze well in air-tight containers with waxed paper between layers.

title: 133. CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST
(Make Ahead Breakfast)

ingredients

7 slices white bread
2 pkg. (4 oz. each) shredded Cheddar cheese
6 eggs
3 c. milk
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
1 tsp. dry mustard
3 strips bacon, cut up

preparation

Trim crusts from bread. Crumble bread. Mix bread and cheese and spread in bottom of greased 7 1/2 x 12-inch flat baking dish. Beat eggs and milk together and stir in salt, pepper and mustard. Pour over bread and cheese. Lay bacon on top. Refrigerate overnight. Next morning, bake uncovered, at 350° for 50 to 55 minutes. Serves 6. Make this the day before.

title: 234. CHRISTMAS PICKLES
info:
CHRISTMAS PICKLES

ingredients

1 gal. medium whole cucumbers
4 c. vinegar
4 Tbsp. alum
4 Tbsp. salt
4 Tbsp. pickling spice
6 c. sugar

preparation

Wash whole cucumbers and pack tightly in wide-mouth gallon jar (glass). Combine vinegar, alum, salt and pickling spice. Pour this solution over cucumbers in jar. Put lid on tight and set in a cool place for 2 weeks or more or can leave until a few weeks before Christmas.

Turn jar upside-down every few days so brine will cover pickles. When ready to use, pour off brine. Take out cucumbers and rinse off. Rinse out jar. Now slice or cube the cucumbers and put back into jar. Add 6 cups sugar. Mix by turning or shaking the jar, so sugar will dissolve. Put lid on tight. Let set overnight. Can be used as soon as you desire. Use right from the jar, no canning to do. Can let set on counter or cabinet top or put in the refrigerator for cooler, crisp pickle taste. Yummy!

title: 40. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

1 can cherry pie filling
1 can Eagle Brand milk
1 (15 1/2 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained
1 c. chopped pecans
1 c. mini marshmallows
1 c. Angel Flake coconut
1 (12 oz.) tub Cool Whip

preparation

Combine all ingredients and fold into Cool Whip. Let set and chill 4 to 5 hours or overnight.

title: 132. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

2 c. cranberry juice
3 c. pineapple juice
1 1/2 c. water
1/3 c. brown sugar
3 sticks cinnamon, broken
2 tsp. whole cloves
2 tsp. allspice

preparation

Combine juices and water in bottom part of percolator. Place all other ingredients in basket of percolator. Perk 5 to 10 minutes. This makes a delicious drink for a party or just to serve on cold days at home.

title: 68. CHRISTMAS FRUIT CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS FRUIT CAKE

ingredients

1 lb. walnuts
1 lb. pecans
1 lb. bag marshmallows
1/3 c. milk
1 lb. box graham crackers
1 lb. jar cherries
1 lb. box raisins

preparation

Crush graham crackers to a powder. Chop cherries, leaving 5 or 6 for decoration. Melt marshmallows in milk. Mix all ingredients, a little at a time, into hot marshmallows. When mixture becomes cool, you can begin mixing with your hands. You will need to add cherry juice as you mix to keep ingredients moist. Place a drinking glass on cake plate and pat the cake mixture around glass until you "make a cake" around it. Set in the refrigerator until firm. Remove glass.

Can freeze for later. Slice leftover cherries to decorate top.

title: 285. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

1 can applesauce
1 pkg. raspberry jello
1 small can crushed pineapple
1/2 c. nuts

preparation

Boil applesauce in saucepan. Stir in small jello. Mix well. Add crushed pineapple and chopped nuts. Mix well. Pour in jello mold. Chill.

title: 75. CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAKFAST

ingredients

2 1/4 c. seasoned croutons
1 1/2 lb. pork sausage
4 eggs, beaten
2 1/4 c. milk
1 (10 oz.) can cream of mushroom soup (undiluted)
1 (4 oz.) can mushrooms, drained
3/4 tsp. dry mustard
2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese

preparation

Spread croutons in a lightly greased 13 x 9 pan. Cook sausage well until brown, stirring to crumble. Drain well. Sprinkle sausage over croutons. Combine eggs, milk, soup, mushrooms and mustard; mix well and pour over sausage. Cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight. Remove from refrigerator and let stand 30 minutes. Bake uncovered at 325° for 50 to 55 minutes. Sprinkle cheese over top and bake an additional 5 minutes.

title: 269. CHOCOLATE COVERED CHRISTMAS BALLS
info:
CHOCOLATE COVERED CHRISTMAS BALLS

ingredients

1 can condensed milk
2 boxes powdered sugar
1 stick oleo
2 c. grated coconut
2 c. chopped pecans
1 large pkg. semi-sweet chocolate pieces
2/3 cake paraffin wax

preparation

Combine milk, sugar and oleo. Add grated coconut and chopped pecans. Roll into small balls and freeze hard. Melt chocolate and wax in a double boiler. Dip frozen balls into chocolate. Let cool on waxed paper. (Stick toothpick in ball to dip in chocolate and wax mixture.) Let cool on waxed paper.

title: 77. DIABETIC WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE
info:
DIABETIC WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE

ingredients

1 envelope Knox gelatine
1/4 c. water
2 Tbsp. Sugar Twin
3 Tbsp. flour
1/2 tsp. salt
1 1/2 c. milk
1 tsp. vanilla
1/4 tsp. almond extract
2 egg whites
3/4 c. coconut
Dream Whip
baked pie shell

preparation

Soften gelatine in cold water. Combine Sugar Twin, flour, salt and milk. Cool until thick. Add softened gelatine, stirring until dissolved. Add vanilla and almond extract. Chill. Whip Dream Whip and fold in gelatine mixture. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold them into the mixture carefully. Fold in coconut. Chill until firm. Garnish with coconut and gumdrops.

title: 237. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 large can frozen pink lemonade
3 large cans water (use lemonade can)
1 (46 oz.) can pink grapefruit-pineapple juice
1 (46 oz.) can pineapple juice
1 large bottle cranberry juice cocktail
2 large bottles ginger ale

preparation

Combine all ingredients (except ginger ale). The ginger ale should be added just prior to serving. If more color is desired, add a few drops of food coloring. This mixture may be made ahead of time and frozen. Serves 35 to 40.

title: 170. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

3 6 oz cans frozen lemonade concentrate
1 pound box frozen strawberries
1 quart ginger ale

preparation

Prepare lemonade as directed, add thawed strawberries and ice cubes. Add ginger ale just before serving. Makes 1 1/2 gallons of punch.

title: 169. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 pkg. presweetened strawberry drink mix, dissolved in 1 qt. water
1 (13 oz.) can orange juice (3 cans water added)
1 (6 oz.) can lemonade (4 cans water added)
1 large can pineapple juice
1 c. sugar
2 qt. water

preparation

For carbonated punch, use Sprite or ginger ale or 7-Up in place of water. For really sweet punch, use white grape juice in place of water.

title: 202. CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER
info:
CHRISTMAS CAULIFLOWER

ingredients

1 large head cauliflower, broken into florets
1/4 cup diced green pepper
1 jar (7.3 oz.) sliced mushrooms, drained
1/4 cup butter or margarine
1/3 cup all purpose flour
2 cup milk
1 cup shredded Swiss cheese
2 Tbsp. diced pimientos
1 tsp. salt
Paprika, optional

preparation

In a large saucepan, cook cauliflower in a small amount of water for 6-7 minutes or until crisp-tender; drain well. In a medium saucepan, sauté green pepper and mushrooms in butter for 2 minutes. Add flour; gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil; boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat; stir in cheese until melted. Add pimientos and salt. Place half of the cauliflower in a greased 2 qt. baking dish; top with half of the sauce. Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, at 325° for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with paprika if desired.

Yield: 8-10 servings.
