title: 58. FUDGY CHRISTMAS WREATH
info:
FUDGY CHRISTMAS WREATH

ingredients

1 (14 oz.) can sweetened condensed milk
2 c. (12 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate chips
1 c. chopped walnuts
1/2 tsp. vanilla extract
red and green maraschino cherries

preparation

In a saucepan over low heat, cook and stir milk and chocolate chips until chocolate melts and mixture is slightly thickened, about 6 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in nuts and vanilla. Cool until it starts to set, about 15 minutes. Line a baking sheet with waxed paper. Spoon chocolate mixture by 2 tablespoonfuls into small mounds to form a wreath. Decorate with cherries. Chill until firm. Serve chilled. Yield: about 24 servings.

title: 61. WILLARD SCOTT'S FAVORITE CHRISTMAS CAKE
info:
WILLARD SCOTT'S FAVORITE CHRISTMAS CAKE

ingredients

2 1/2 c. self-rising flour
1/4 c. (2 oz.) red food coloring
1 1/2 c. vegetable oil
1 tsp. baking soda
1 tsp. vanilla
1 c. buttermilk
1 1/2 c. granulated sugar
2 large eggs
1 tsp. cocoa
1 tsp. white vinegar

preparation

Heat oven to 350°. Mix together all ingredients with an electric mixer. Spray three 9-inch round cake pans with nonstick coating. Pour batter equally into the 3 pans and bake for 20 minutes. Test for doneness with a toothpick. Cool layers in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes. Carefully remove layers from pans to rack to cool completely.

Frosting:

ingredients

1 1/3 sticks butter, softened
10 oz. cream cheese, softened
1 (1 lb.) box powdered sugar
2 c. chopped pecans

preparation

Combine butter, cream cheese and powdered sugar in a bowl. Beat until fluffy, then fold in 1 1/2 cups pecans; use to fill and frost cake when it is cool. Decorate top of cake with remaining 1/2 cup pecans; refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Makes 10 to 15 servings.

title: 138. CHRISTMAS SCENT
info:
CHRISTMAS SCENT

ingredients

3 (4-inch) sticks cinnamon
3 bay leaves
1/4 c. cloves
1/2 lemon, halved
1/2 orange, halved
1 qt. water

preparation

Combine all ingredients in tea kettle or saucepan and bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer as long as desired. Check often and add additional water, if needed. Mixture may be stored in refrigerator for several days and reused. Yield: 4 cups.

title: 89. White Christmas Salad
info:
White Christmas Salad

ingredients

1 pkg. Lemon jell-o
1 1/4 c. hot water
1/2 c. pineapple juice
1/2 c. whipping cream (whipped)
1/2 c. mayonnaise
1/2 c. diced apples (unpeeled)
1/2 c. diced pineapple
1/2 c. diced celery
6 marshmallows, cut in small pieces

preparation

Dissolve jell-o in hot water, adding pineapple juice. When it begins to congeal, fold in whipped cream and remaining ingredients. Chill until firm. Serves 10.

title: 151. CHRISTMAS EGG CASSEROLE
info:
CHRISTMAS EGG CASSEROLE

ingredients

1 lb. pork sausage
6 eggs
2 c. milk
2 slices bread, cubed
1 c. sharp cheddar cheese, grated
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. dry mustard

preparation

Sauté the sausage, drain all the grease and set aside. Beat the eggs, add milk, salt and mustard, stir. Layer the bread cubes on the bottom of a 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Then layer the sausage, followed by cheese. Pour the egg mixture over the top, cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

title: 162. CHRISTMAS GOLD FRUIT CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS GOLD FRUIT CAKE

ingredients

1 1/2 c. butter or margarine
2 c. sugar
6 eggs, separated
1/2 tsp. cream of tartar
1 c. milk
1 tsp. brandy extract or 3/4 c. milk and 1/4 c. brandy
1 tsp. vanilla
3 1/2 c. flour
1/2 tsp. salt
2 c. golden raisins
1 c. chopped dried apricots
1/2 c. chopped, candied orange peel
1 c. coarsely chopped walnuts

preparation

Beat butter until light and creamy. Gradually add the sugar, beating until smooth. Beat egg yolks together lightly and add to mixture. Combine milk, brandy and vanilla. Mix flour and salt together. Alternately add milk mix and flour mix to butter mix. Fold in fruits and nuts. Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff, but not dry. Fold whites into batter gently, but thoroughly. Pour mixture into two buttered and floured six-cup molds. Bake at 275° for 2 1/2 hours or until they test done. Cool and unmold.

title: 293. GRANDMA'S CHRISTMAS BREAD
info:
GRANDMA'S CHRISTMAS BREAD

ingredients

5 - 6 c. all purpose flour
1/2 c. sugar
2 tsp. ground cardamom
1 tsp. salt
2 pkg. active dry yeast
1 c. milk
2/3 c. butter or margarine
2 eggs
1- 15 oz. pkg. light seedless raisins
1- 6 oz. candied fruit
1 egg white, slightly beaten

preparation

In large bowl, combine 2 cups of flour, sugar, cardamom, salt and yeast. In medium saucepan over low heat, heat milk, butter/margarine, and 1/2 cup water until very warm (120 - 130 degrees), butter/margarine does not need to totally melt. With mixer at low speed, gradually pour liquid into dry ingredients. Increase speed to medium; beat two minutes, occasionally scraping bowl with rubber spatula. Beat in eggs and 3/4 c. flour or enough to make a thick batter. Continue beating 2 minutes, occasionally scraping bowl. With spoon, stir in enough additional flour, about 1 1/2 - 2 cups, to make a soft dough.

Turn dough onto lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 10 minutes. Shape dough into ball and place in greased large bowl, turning over so that top of dough is greased. Cover with towel and let rise in warm place (80 - 85 degrees) away from draft, until doubles, about 1 1/2 hours. Dough is doubled when two fingers pressed lightly into dough leaves a dent. Punch down dough by pushing down center with fist, then pushing edges of dough into center. Turn dough on to lightly floured surface. Put fruit in a ziploc bag with a small amount of flour. Knead fruit into dough. Cut dough in half and cover with bowl for 15 minutes. Grease 2- 9 inch x 5 inch loaf pans.

With a lightly floured rolling pin, roll dough half into 12 inch x 8 inch rectangle. Starting with 8 inch end, roll dough jelly-roll fashion. Pinch seams to seal. Press ends to seal and tuck under. Place seam side down in loaf pan. Repeat with remaining dough. Cover with towel and let rise 1 hour until doubled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brush tops of loaves with egg white, or melted butter. Bake 45 - 50 minutes until loaves sound hollow when lightly tapped with finger. Remove from pans immediately and cool on racks.

title: 53. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. butter or margarine
1 c. sugar
2 eggs
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 tsp. salt
3 c. flour

preparation

Mix well and chill. Roll to 1/4-inch thick on floured board and cut with cookie cutters. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool and frost or decorate as desired.

title: 45. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

2 c. ground cranberries
3/4 c. sugar
2 c. miniature marshmallows
2 c. diced apples
1/2 c. green grapes, halved and seeded
1/2 c. crushed pineapple, drained
1/2 c. chopped pecans
1 c. Cool Whip

preparation

Mix cranberries, sugar and marshmallows together; refrigerate overnight. The next day, add the remaining ingredients. Mix all together. Chill in refrigerator before serving. Makes 12 servings.

title: 255. CHRISTMAS CAKE COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS CAKE COOKIES

ingredients

2 lbs. dates
1/2 lb. candied cherries
1/2 lb. candied pineapple
1/2 lb. English walnuts
1/2 lb. pecans
2 1/2 c. sifted flour
1 tsp. baking soda
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. cinnamon
1 c. butter
1 1/2 c. sugar
2 eggs

preparation

Discard date pits and cut dates in chunks. (I purchase the pitted dates.) Cut candied cherries in quarters. Slice candied pineapple in thin slivers. Chop walnuts and pecans coarsely (you can use almonds but you need to toast them until golden. You can also use Brazil nuts with the almonds, but they are a little crunchy. You might vary the nuts to your liking.) Sift flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon together. Start oven at 350°F or moderately hot. Cream butter until soft and creamy. Add sugar gradually and continue working until smooth. Beat in the eggs thoroughly, then stir in sifted flour combination and all fruit and nuts.

Drop cookie batter from teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets and bake approximately 10 minutes. Don't overbake as cookies are nicer when soft in texture. Remove from oven, cool slightly and remove from cookie sheets. Makes 150 to 170 delicious little cookies which keep extremely well.

title: 204. CHRISTMAS DANISH PUFF PASTRY
info:
CHRISTMAS DANISH PUFF PASTRY

ingredients

1/2 c. butter
2 Tbsp. ice water
1 c. flour
1/2 c. butter
1 c. flour
1 c. water
3 eggs

preparation

In a bowl, cut 1/2 cup butter into 1 cup flour. Sprinkle the cold water over the mixture. Stir until blended. Shape into a ball and divide in two. Roll each piece into a 3 x 12-inch oblong. Place them on a baking sheet. Spread with your favorite jam and refrigerate.

In a saucepan, bring 1/2 cup butter and 1 cup water to a rolling boil until the butter is melted. Stir in all the flour at once. Beat vigorously over low heat until mixture leaves the pan and forms a ball. Remove from heat. Beat in the eggs, one at a time. Mixture should be smooth and satiny. Spread over the pastries (seal the edges so that the jam will not seep out). Bake in a 425° oven until puffed and golden (about 30 minutes). Remove to a rack and cool.

Icing:

ingredients

1 c. confectioners sugar
2 Tbsp. hot milk
1/2 Tbsp. butter
1/2 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Mix these ingredients together. Spread over pastry just before serving.

title: 171. CHRISTMAS BALLS
info:
CHRISTMAS BALLS

ingredients

2 lb confectioners sugar
1 can sweetened condensed milk
1/2 cup or 2 sticks butter
Chocolate chips
paraffin wax

preparation

Mix together sugar milk and butter.

Melt chips and wax.

Roll sugar mixture into balls and dip in melted chocolate mixture.

title: 248. CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

1 lg. box orange jello
1 lg. can crushed pineapple
1 lg. can fruit cocktail
1 sm. jar cherries
1 bag mini-marshmallows
1 - 12 oz. tub Cool Whip
Walnuts if you wish

preparation

Drain fruit well, add jello, marshmallows and walnuts. Blend in Cool Whip and chill.

title: 249. CHRISTMAS BEAN SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS BEAN SALAD
(A Sweet and Sour Salad)

ingredients

1 can French style green beans
1 small can sweet peas
1/4 c. celery, chopped finely
1/2 c. bell pepper, chopped finely
1/2 c. onion, chopped finely (purple ones are pretty)
1/2 small jar pimento
1 tsp. salt
1/4 c. vegetable oil
1 c. sugar
1/2 c. vinegar

preparation

Mix green beans, peas, celery, bell pepper, onion, and pimento together in medium bowl.

Mix salt, vegetable oil, sugar and vinegar together. Pour this over vegetables.

Allow mixture to sit overnight, refrigerated, stirring 2 or 3 times.

Drain off liquid before serving.

title: 176. CHRISTMAS PUNCH
info:
CHRISTMAS PUNCH

ingredients

1 gal Apple Cider
6 lemons
6 small oranges
1 qt canned pineapple juice
1 (3 inch) stick cinnamon
8 whole cloves
3 or 4 cardamon seed
1/2 tsp salt
3 pieces ginger

preparation

Place the spices in a bag of fine cheesecloth. Peel and cut into thin slices, the lemons and oranges, mixing with the apple cider and pineapple juice. To this add the bag of spices and bring to a very low simmering boil. Stir as it simmers for approximately 15 minutes, then add salt and stir vigorously.

title: 263. CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS
info:
CHRISTMAS PARTY PINWHEELS

ingredients

2 pkg (8 oz. each) cream cheese, softened
1 pkg (4 oz.) ranch salad dressing mix
1/2 cup minced sweet pepper
1/2 cup minced celery
1/4 cup sliced green olives
1/4 cup sliced green onions
2 to 4 (10 inch) flour tortillas

preparation

In mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and dressing mix until smooth. Add red pepper, celery, onions and olives: mix well. Spread about 3/4 cup on each tortilla. Roll up tightly; wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Slice into 1/2 inch pieces. Yield 15 - 20 servings.

title: 150. STRAWBERRY CHRISTMAS SALAD
info:
STRAWBERRY CHRISTMAS SALAD

ingredients

2 pkg. strawberry gelatin
1 1/2 c. hot water
2 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen strawberries, thawed
1 (No. 303) can crushed pineapple
2 bananas, mashed
1 pt. sour cream

preparation

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Add strawberries and pineapple. Chill until thickened. Add bananas. Pour 1/2 of mixture into a 9 x 11-inch pan. Chill until firm. Spread with sour cream. Pour remaining gelatin mixture on top. Chill until firm. Cut into squares to serve. Yield: 9 servings.

title: 50. MEDITERRANEAN  CHRISTMAS BREAD
info:
MEDITERRANEAN CHRISTMAS BREAD

ingredients

1/4 oz. pkg. (2 1/2 tsp.) dry yeast
1/4 c. warm water
2 tsp. cardamom
1/4 tsp. salt
2 egg whites, room temperature
1/3 c. sugar
1/4 c. skim milk, room temperature
1/8 c. vegetable oil
1 1/2 c. whole wheat flour
1 c. white flour
1/4 c. raisins
1/4 c. chopped walnuts

preparation

Dissolve yeast, 1/3 of sugar, in small bowl with warm water. In a large bowl, mix rest of sugar with cardamom, salt, egg whites, milk, and oil. Add yeast and rest of ingredients. Mix well to blend. Knead on floured board 5 minutes until smooth, elastic. Shape into ball, place in sprayed 8 inch round cake pan. Cover with damp cloth, let dough rise to double. Bake 350° 35-40 minutes until golden brown.

title: 299. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 lb. red cherries
1 lb. green cherries
1 lb. assorted pineapple
2 c. coconut
4 c. pecans
1 tsp. vanilla
4 eggs, beaten
1 can condensed milk
1 box Duncan Hines yellow cake mix

preparation

Cut up fruit and nuts until fine. Pour cake mix over all and mix gently. Add flavoring and milk to beaten eggs. Drop by spoonful onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.

title: 156. CHRISTMAS SCONES
info:
CHRISTMAS SCONES

ingredients

2 1/4 C. self-rising flour
1/3 C. sugar
1/2 tsp. baking soda
1 C. cranberries, chopped
1/2 C. buttermilk
2 Tbsp. grated orange peel
1/2 C. butter
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Combine flour sugar, orange peel and baking soda. Cut in butter until resembles crumbs. Add cranberries. Add buttermilk and vanilla. Form dough into 2 equal balls. On floured surface work ball into 6 inch circle 1/2 inch thick. Cut circle into 6 wedges. Place on nonstick baking sheet, leaving 1 inch between each one. Repeat using remaining dough. Bake until lightly brown, about 10-15 minutes. Serve with whipped cream and orange marmalade. Makes 12 servings

title: 112. CHRISTMAS FUDGE
info:
CHRISTMAS FUDGE

ingredients

1 (7 oz.) jar marshmallow cream
1 (13 oz.) can Carnation milk
1 1/2 lb. chocolate kisses
5 c. sugar
1/2 c. butter
6 c. pecan halves
1 tsp. vanilla

preparation

Mix sugar, milk and butter. Bring to a boil. Cook 8 minutes. Pour mixture over marshmallow cream and kisses. Stir until kisses melt. Stir in nuts. Makes approximately 5 pounds of candy. Great for gifts.

title: 205. CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS
info:
CHRISTMAS MORNING ROLLS

ingredients

1 bag dozen dinner rolls
1 box butterscotch pudding (not instant)
1/2 c. butter or oleo
3/4 c. brown sugar
3/4 tsp. cinnamon
1/2 c. chopped nuts

preparation

Arrange rolls in greased 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle dry pudding mix over rolls. Cook butter and remaining ingredients over low heat until sugar dissolves and mixture bubbles. Pour over rolls. Cover lightly with foil and let stand on counter overnight. Next morning, bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes, then invert carefully on serving dish.

title: 124. CHRISTMAS LIZZIES
info:
CHRISTMAS LIZZIES

ingredients

4 eggs
1 1/2 c. brown sugar
1 stick butter
3 tsp. soda
3 c. flour (plain)
1 tsp. cloves
1 tsp. nutmeg
1 tsp. salt
1 1/2 lb. chopped nuts
1 lb. glazed pineapple
1 lb. glazed cherries
1 lb. raisins
3/4 c. cherry juice
3 Tbsp. milk
1 lb. dates, chopped
2 c. coconut

preparation

Line cookie sheet with freezer paper. Do not grease. Sift all dry ingredients together. Cream sugar and butter. Add dry ingredients alternately with juice to butter and sugar mixture. Add fruit and nuts which have been lightly floured. Drop on cookie sheet and bake at 275° until brown (about 25 minutes).

title: 189. NE-NE'S CHRISTMAS SAUSAGE QUICHE
info:
NE-NE'S CHRISTMAS SAUSAGE QUICHE

ingredients

1 lb. sausage
2 - 9 in. pie crusts
1 c. grated swiss cheese
1 lb. grated cheddar cheese
4 large eggs beaten
2/3 c. milk
dash salt
1 - 8 oz. sour cream

preparation

Cook sausage and crumble; drain. Line pie crusts with sausage. Sprinkle cheese over sausage. Beat together eggs, milk, salt, and sour cream. Pour over sausage. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour.

title: 298. CHRISTMAS APPLESAUCE CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS APPLESAUCE CAKE

ingredients

2 c. sugar
2 c. applesauce
1 c. nuts
1 tsp. salt
2 tsp. vanilla
2 tsp. allspice (optional)
1/2 c. shortening
2 c. raisins
2 tsp. soda
2 tsp. cinnamon
2 tsp. nutmeg (optional)
2 1/2 c. flour

preparation

Mix all ingredients thoroughly and pour into well-greased tube pan. Bake 1 hour in 350° oven.

No need for icing but a little plain powdered sugar icing can be used.

title: 300. CHRISTMAS WHITE CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS WHITE CAKE

ingredients

1 lb. Brazil nuts
1 lb. walnuts
1 lb. dates
2 jars maraschino cherries
1 1/2 cups flour
1 1/2 cups sugar
4 well beaten eggs
1/2 c. butter

preparation

Combine Brazil, walnuts, dates and cherries. Sprinkle with flour. Take juice from cherries and mix flour, sugar, eggs and butter. Combine all ingredients and bake at 270 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.

title: 287. PRETTY PEARS FOR CHRISTMAS
info:
PRETTY PEARS FOR CHRISTMAS

ingredients

1 large can pear halves, drained
red and green food coloring

preparation

Divide juice 1/2 and 1/2 in bowls. Add green coloring to one; add red coloring to other. Darken to your liking. Add pears and refrigerate overnight.

Filling:

ingredients

1 brick cream cheese
1 c. mayonnaise
1 c. ground nuts

preparation

Mix together and scoop into colored pear halves, about 1 teaspoon each. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

title: 24. CHRISTMAS CANDY WREATH
info:
CHRISTMAS CANDY WREATH

ingredients

1 wire coat hanger
5 yards (2-inches wide)
material (an old piece of cotton sheet works well)
4 feet aluminum foil
1 spool fine wire
4 lb. individually wrapped assorted candies
1 ribbon bow
1 pair scissors

preparation

Cut coat hanger in center of wire base and then bring ends together. Shape into approximately 10-inch circle; wire ends together with fine wire. Cover circle by winding the 2-inch material using the entire 5 yards to form the base. Then, wrap the foil around the material. The fine wire for putting candy on the wreath should be in about 4 foot lengths or whatever length is convenient to work with. When the preferred length is used, make a loop on the end by bending the end back and then twisting. Place next wire through loop; bend end over and twist, thereby fastening ends.

Begin by fastening fine wire at base of hook. Twist wire around candy wrapper as tight and close to candy as possible. Twist around candy wrapper twice. Place pieces as close together as possible. This will make the wreath fuller. Foil should not show through. Repeat this until complete.

Place scissors on a narrow piece of ribbon and tie to wreath hanger on top. These will be used for cutting candy off rather than to pull or tear. Use large bow over hook and hang wreath in well observed position.

title: 28. WHITE CHRISTMAS CAKE
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS CAKE

ingredients

3 c. chopped mixed candied fruits
2 2/3 c. flaked coconut
1 1/2 c. coarsely chopped almonds
1 1/2 tsp. grated orange rind
1 1/2 c. golden raisins
1/3 c. orange juice
1/2 c. apple juice
3/4 c. margarine
3 3/4 c. cake flour
1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
3/4 tsp. salt
1 1/2 c. sugar
6 eggs
1/2 c. apple juice

preparation

Combine candied fruits, coconut, raisins, almonds and orange rind in a large bowl. Sift flour, baking powder and salt over fruit. Mix well. Cream margarine with sugar in medium bowl. Beat in eggs; stir in apple and orange juice. Pour over fruit mixture; fold and mix thoroughly. Spoon batter into a greased and floured 8-inch pan. Bake at 375° for 3 hours. Cool completely in pan. On serving day, put on an Orange Glaze. Makes an 8-inch round cake.

Orange Glaze:

ingredients

1 Tbsp. melted margarine
1 Tbsp. orange juice
2 1/2 c. powdered sugar

preparation

Beat all until smooth and creamy. Makes about 3/4 cup.

title: 97. CHRISTMAS BREAD OR FRUIT BREAD
info:
CHRISTMAS BREAD OR FRUIT BREAD

ingredients

2 pkg. active dry yeast
1 Tbsp. sugar
1/3 c. lukewarm water
3 c. milk
1/2 c. butter
3 Tbsp. sugar
1 1/2 tsp. salt
3 c. all-purpose flour
3 eggs
1 c. white raisins
1 c. currants
1 c. candied cherries
1 1/2 c. mixed candied fruit
6 1/2 c. flour
1/2 tsp. ground cardamon seeds or 1/2 tsp. lemon rind, grated (may add)

preparation

Soften yeast and one tablespoon sugar in warm water. Scald milk and pour over the butter, sugar and salt. When lukewarm, add the yeast and three cups flour. Beat thoroughly. Add rest of ingredients and stir until well mixed. Beat until smooth and elastic. Brush with melted butter; cover and let rise until light, 1 1/4 hours. Beat well and fill buttered bread pans 2/3 full. Brush with melted butter. Cover and let rise until light, 3/4 hour. Brush lightly with milk and sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes. Makes 3 or 4 loaves, depending upon size of bread pans.

title: 175. CHRISTMAS EGGNOG
info:
CHRISTMAS EGGNOG

ingredients

6 c. cold milk
6 eggs
12 tsp. sugar
3 Tbsp. vanilla
6 scoops vanilla ice cream
nutmeg

preparation

Mix all ingredients together in a bowl or blender. Mix until smooth. Store in refrig. until time to serve. Pour into punch bowl and sprinkle with nutmeg.

title: 52. "CHRISTMAS YUMMY BARS"
info:
"CHRISTMAS YUMMY BARS"

ingredients

1 (12 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips
1 (12 oz.) pkg. peanut chips
2 c. peanut butter
1 oz. unsweetened chocolate
1 c. butter or margarine
1/4 c. vanilla cooking pudding
1/2 c. evaporated milk
1 tsp. vanilla
2 lb. powdered sugar
1 lb. peanuts, salted

preparation

Melt first 4 ingredients. Pour half into jelly roll pan. Refrigerate the other half; just keep in pan. Then combine butter, pudding and milk. On medium heat, boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add flavoring and powdered sugar. Pour slowly on top of chocolate layer. Freeze until hard. Add peanuts to remaining ingredients. Spread melted chocolate on top. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into 1-inch squares.

title: 31. CHRISTMAS DECORATIONS
info:
CHRISTMAS DECORATIONS
(Confectioners Glue Recipe)

ingredients

1 large egg white
1 3/4 c. confectioners sugar

preparation

Blend in small mixer bowl. Beat 2 minutes at high speed. Yield: 3/4 cup.

Cut stockings out of cardboard. Cover with red or silver foil; glue on Hershey's Kisses until covered.

To make tree, cover Styrofoam cone with green or silver foil; glue on Hershey's Kisses.

To make wreath, form circle with pipe cleaners 5 rows thick. Twist ends together; cover with foil. Glue on Hershey's Kisses.

title: 198. BEST CHRISTMAS DRESSING
info:
BEST CHRISTMAS DRESSING

ingredients

whole chicken, (cooked & deboned), save broth
4 frozen biscuits, cooked
1 pan of cornbread
3 eggs
celery
onion

preparation

Mix all ingredients with plenty of broth. Pour in large casserole dish. Cover and bake in 350 degree oven for 1 hour.

title: 145. CHRISTMAS CRUNCH SALAD
info:
CHRISTMAS CRUNCH SALAD

Main Part:

ingredients

4 c. fresh broccoli florets
4 c. fresh cauliflower
1 medium red onion (chopped)
1 c. cherry tomatoes 9 Halved

preparation

Mix with Dressing.

Dressing:

ingredients

1 c. mayonnaise
1/2 c. sour cream
1 to 2 Tbsp. sugar
1 Tbsp. vinegar
Salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Pour dressing over veggies. Mix - Chill about 2 hours.

title: 212. WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE

ingredients

1 pkg, unflavored gelatin
1/4 c. hot water
1 c. sugar
5 level Tbsp. flour
2 c. milk
1 c. whipped cream
1 tsp. vanilla
1 tsp. almond extract

preparation

Dissolve gelatin in water and let stand. Combine sugar, flour and milk in a small saucepan. Over medium heat let boil and thicken while constantly stirring. Remove from heat, stir in gelatin and let cool. Add whip cream, vanilla and almond extract. Mix well and pour into a graham cracker crust. Refrigerate.

title: 230. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. butter
1 1/2 c. sugar
2 eggs
2 tsp. vanilla
1 tsp. almond extract
3 1/2 c. all-purpose flour
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. baking powder
1/2 tsp. baking soda

preparation

Cream together butter, sugar and eggs. In separate bowl, combine flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Add flour mixture gradually to butter mixture. Mix well. Add vanilla and almond extracts.

Option 1: You may add 1/3 cup pistachios.

Option 2: You may add 2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips.

Option 3: Roll out each cookie into a ball. Make thumbprint in the center of each cookie. Fill hole with a drop of seedless raspberry preserves.

Option 4:

ingredients

1 oz. red food coloring
1 Tbsp. milk
1 oz. green food coloring
1 Tbsp. milk

preparation

You may halve cookie dough and add red food coloring and 1 tablespoon milk to one half of dough and green food coloring and 1 tablespoon milk to the other half. Roll out each half to equal lengths. Braid together and cut to desired size.

Bake at 350° until done.

title: 126. CHRISTMAS COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS COOKIES

ingredients

1 c. brown sugar
1 c. soft oleo
3 eggs, well beaten
3 c. flour
1 tsp. soda
1 tsp. cinnamon
1 tsp. cloves
1/2 tsp. nutmeg
1 1/2 c. dates
6 slices candied pineapple
2 c. candied red and green cherries
7 c. nuts

preparation

In medium bowl cream together the sugar, oleo and eggs. Set aside. In separate bowl combine flour, soda, cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg. Add to the creamed mixture. Blend well. Then add fruit and nuts. Drop by small teaspoon and bake for 15 minutes at 300°.

title: 30. CHRISTMAS TEA
info:
CHRISTMAS TEA

ingredients

1 qt. water
3 c. sugar
cinnamon sticks
whole cloves
whole allspice
8 tea bags
2 large cans pineapple-orange juice
1 large can grapefruit juice
1 large bottle apple juice
1/2 c. lemon juice
1/2 pt. apricot brandy

preparation

Syrup: Combine 1 quart water, sugar, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves and allspice. Boil rapidly for at least 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, steep tea bags in 6 cups water until very strong. Remove spices from syrup except for a couple cinnamon sticks. Pour juices in with syrup in very large pan. Use only 1/2 can of grapefruit juice. Add tea and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Then add apricot brandy, if desired. Makes about 2 gallons.

title: 25. CHRISTMAS CHEER DESSERT
info:
CHRISTMAS CHEER DESSERT

ingredients

1/4 c. creme de menthe
1 pt. lime sherbet, softened
1 qt. vanilla ice cream, softened
1 pkg. Dream Whip, prepared per directions on pkg.

preparation

Mix all together with mixer and refreeze.

title: 215. CHRISTMAS RAINBOW POKE CAKE
info:
CHRISTMAS RAINBOW POKE CAKE

ingredients

1 (18.25 oz.) pkg. Betty Crocker SuperMoist white cake mix
1 (3 oz.) pkg. raspberry gelatin
1 (3 oz.) pkg. lime gelatin
2 c. boiling water
1 (8 oz.) container Cool Whip, thawed

preparation

Prepare cake mix as directed on package. Pour into two 8 or 9-inch round pans. Bake as directed. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans. Cool completely. Place cake layers, top side up, back in cleaned pans. Prick each with a utility fork at about 1/2-inch intervals. Pour 1 cup of the boiling water over the raspberry gelatin; stir until dissolved. Spoon over one layer. Repeat with lime gelatin over other layer. Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours. Dip one layer in pan of hot water for 10 seconds; invert on serving plate. Spread with 1 cup Cool Whip. Repeat with remaining layer, inverting it onto the Cool Whip. Frost with remaining Cool Whip. Refrigerate. Garnish with flattened gumdrops out to resemble holly, if desired.

title: 155. WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE
info:
WHITE CHRISTMAS PIE

ingredients

1 Tbsp. gelatin
1/4 c cold water
1/2 c. sugar
4 Tbsp flour
1/2 tsp salt
1 1/2 c. milk
3/4 tsp vanilla
1/4 tsp almond extract
1/2 c. whipping cream
3 egg whites---3/8 c.
1/4 tsp cream of tartar
1/2 c. sugar
1 c. shredded coconut

preparation

Soften gelatin in cold water, mix together in saucepan, sugar, flour, salt and milk. Cook over low heat, stirring until boils. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in gelatin. Cool. When partially set, beat with rotary beater until smooth. Blend in vanilla and almond. Gently fold in cream, whipped until stiff and carefully fold all in meringue of egg whites beaten stiff with sugar and cream of tartar. Last, fold in 1 c. of coconut. Pile into cooled baked pie shell. Sprinkle with moist shredded coconut. Chill until set, about 2 hours. Serve cold.

Note: Take out of refrigerator 20 minutes before serving.

title: 217. CHRISTMAS REINDEER COOKIES
info:
CHRISTMAS REINDEER COOKIES

ingredients

2 1/2 c. flour
1 tsp. baking powder
1 tsp. vanilla
1/2 tsp. salt
1 c. sugar
3/4 c. soft butter or margarine
2 eggs

preparation

Mix all ingredients except flour. Slowly add flour until makes a ball. For best results, chill half hour or more. Roll out on floured surface. Use any type cookie cutter (we prefer reindeer in our family). Place on cookie sheets sprayed with Pam. Bake at 350° until edges are brown. Cool on rack for frosting.

title: 195. CHRISTMAS A.M. CASSEROLE
info:
CHRISTMAS A.M. CASSEROLE

ingredients

12 pieces bread
2 1/2 c. milk
6 oz. cheese
1 lb. sausage
6 eggs
salt and pepper

preparation

First Layer: 6 pieces bread, 1/2 cup cooked sausage, 1/2 egg, milk mixture and 1/2 of cheese; repeat layer.

Beat milk, eggs, salt and pepper together. Brown sausage and drain. Bake at 350° covered for 25 minutes uncovered 25 minutes. Make day before. Then pop into oven.
